loan.name: Faafete

texts.en:
Faafete is 27 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She lives in the town of Salelavalu Uta. To make a living, Faafete raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Faafete has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 500 WST (approximately $250) a month.
In 2011, Faafete joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Faafete is requesting her first loan for 1,000 WST from SPBD, which she will use to purchase chemicals such as gramoxome. Faafete plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loan.use: to purchase chemicals such as gramoxome.

loan.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 46 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a laborer on construction sites. Mai earns a living running a general store, which she has done for four years.
Mai is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy goods, such as snack foods, biscuits, soft drinks, and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loan.use: to purchase snack foods, biscuits, soft drinks, and confectionery.

loan.name: Truc

texts.en:
Truc, a 46 year-old single woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a business that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.
Truc requests a loan to purchase more products, such as soaps, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo to stock her store. That will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loan.use: to purchase more products, such as soaps, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo

loan.name: Fofoa

texts.en:
"Fofoa is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Pitonuu. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Fofoa owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. Fofoa has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 400 WST (approximately 200USD) a month from these activities.
In 2011, Fofoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fofoa requested her first loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Fofoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

loan.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loan.name: Thang

texts.en:
Thang, 36, is married and has two children: a son and daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a driver.
Thang supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business eleven years ago. She sells rices, soft drinks and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular rice and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loan.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular rice and beverages

loan.name: Tak

texts.en:
Tak, 33, is a humble rice farmer who resides in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She has a common law relationship with her husband who is also a farmer. They have been blessed with three children who are still students in the local public school in the province. Besides working in the field, Tak has been raising pigs at home to increase her household income.

Now Tak would like to acquire a 5,000,000 KHR loan from HKL to pay for local farm laborers to plow her field and to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. Her goal is to expand her farmland and increase its yield so as to better her life.

loan.use: to pay for laborers to plow her field and to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loan.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 42-year-old woman with one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling sugar cane juice, soft drinks and lottery tickets.

For the past eleven years Hoa has run her business to cover her family's daily living expenses and her son's education fees. The business is going smoothly, and she would like a 15,000,000 VND loan from CEP to buy more furniture and many kinds of soft drinks to serve and attract more customers.

Hoa hopes this loan will help her increase her income, improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loan.use: to buy more furniture and a variety of soft drinks to sell.

loan.name: Siulepa

texts.en:
Siulepa is a 23-year-old woman living in the town of Pitonuu. She is married and has a baby.

Siulepa is a farmer. She has planted and harvested fruits and vegetables to sell for over a year, earning approximately 350 WST a month.

In 2011 Siulepa joined SPBD to gain access to its financial services. She has requested a first loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

Siulepa plans to use the additional revenue from her farming to improve it.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loan.name: Prom

texts.en:
Prom is 24 years old and living in Siem Reap province with her small, lovely family. She is a happy and enterprising woman who is the mother of two children. She is married to a humble man, a security guard who earns 3 USD per day.

Prom lives in a working class region where many craftspeople make mats, baskets, etc. Presently, she is a basket weaver, earning about 2.5 USD a day. She enjoys her work and mentions that she is happy with it because it earns her money for her household and gives her time to do other things.

Prom and her husband would like to buy a motorbike to reduce her husbands everyday commuting expenses by motor taxi. For this purpose, they would like to borrow some cash from gentle lenders who always help poor families. This loan of 600 USD, her first from HKL, will allow them to buy their motorbike. She also has great expectations of growing as a businesswoman and learning from other peoples experiences.

With the help of this loan, the couple hopes that their family will have a better life. They also would like to see their children grow up with greater knowledge and a good future. She is very thankful to all lenders who help her family.

loan.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loan.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is 58 years old and married with four children, three sons and one daughter. He and his wife support their family by selling food to the local community.

Diep would like a 15,000,000 VND loan from CEP, which will enable him to buy more furniture to set around his place of business and better food to sell at higher margins.

Diep hopes that through this loan he will be able to improve his family's living conditions and have more money to set aside for saving.

loan.use: to buy more furniture for his establishment and better food to sell.

loan.name: The

texts.en:
The, a 56 year-old married man, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife sell a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

The is requesting a 15,000,000 VND loan from CEP to purchase more products such as sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, rice, soap and candies to stock his store. This will enable him to offer a better range of products to his customers.

The hopes his business will run smoothly, and he can earn additional income to reinvest in his shop and save for emergencies.

loan.use: to purchase more products to stock his store.

loan.name: Molia

texts.en:
Molia is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Satupaitea, Samoa. She is married and has ten adult children.

For the past two years Molia has run a family member's farm where fruits and vegetables are grown. She earns approximately 400 WST a month.

In 2011 Molia joined SPBD to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting her first loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, which will be used to buy pesticides such as gramoxome, an herbicide. She plans to use her profits to improve the farm.

loan.use: to buy pesticides for her farm.

loan.name: Suong

texts.en:
Suong is a 50-year-old divorced woman with a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Suong has been running a food stall for nearly twenty-one years. She sells mainly rice to people in the local community. She would like a 15,000,000 VND loan from CEP to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet her customers' demands.

Through this loan Suong hopes she can earn more money and save it for reinvestment in her business.

loan.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of food.

loan.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is a 48 year-old married woman with two daughters. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband, a driver. Thu runs a shop where she sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Thu is requesting a 15,000,000 VND loan from CEP to buy more products, such as beverages, instant noodles, rice, cookies and milk to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers.

Thu hopes her business will run smoothly and that she can earn extra income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loan.use: To buy more products for her shop.

loan.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh, 56 years old, is married and has four children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a worker in a nearby company.
Nhanh supports her family with the income that she earns running a grocery store. She intends to use her loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of vegetables such as sweet potatoes, onions, gingers, and garlics to sell.
She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loan.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of vegetables such as sweet potatoes, onions, ginger, and garlic

loan.name: Merlani

texts.en:
Merlani is 49 years old. She has four children of school age. They live in the small village of Sibugun, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. Merlan'si family is doing well. Her husband is a government employee. Merlani established a small business to help her husband augment his income.
She is in the retail business running what is known as a 'sari-sari' store that sells soft drinks and other items. She has been in this business for two years and has a proven track record of being able to generate revenue. She has a monthly return of 1,500 php.
She joined GDMPC to gain financial access to engage in business activities to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 4000 php to purchase grocery goods to sell in the store. She is hoping that, through her income, she can further support the education of her children until college.

loan.use: to purchase soft drinks to sell in the store

loan.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is a 53 year-old widow with three sons and one daughter. She lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh City.
Hanh established a grocery store in her local market thirteen years ago. She plans to get a loan to invest capital in her businessand purchase a greater variety and quantity of vegetables to sell.
She hopes that the loan will help her earn more income and improve her family's living conditions.

loan.use: To purchase a greater variety and quantity of vegetables to sell

loan.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung is a 46-year-old married woman with three children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in a pottery company.
Phung earns money selling and repairing cellphones. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Phung would like to take a loan to invest in the business. She plans to use this loan to buy and repair a greater quantity of second-hand cellphones and then sell these to her customers.
She hopes that through this loan she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. This will enable her to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loan.use: To buy and repair second-hand cellphones

loan.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en: Bakhtiyor lives in the town of Istaravshan. He is 57 years old and married. He has five children. He grows onions for trade and has lived in the same area for twenty years. His wife helps him. He has requested a loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loan.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loan.name: Mamlakat

texts.en: Mamlakat sells clothes for women. She has been involved in this type of business for four years. She is 45 years old and married. She has four children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Mamlakat has requested a loan to increase her range of merchandise.

loan.use: to increase her range of merchandise

loan.name: Tung

texts.en:
Tung is 45 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.
He and his wife have been running a general store for nearly eight years. They sell household necessity items and personal use products to people in the local community. He has requested a loan in order to buy a greater quantity and variety of goods to meet his customers' demand.
He hopes that through this loan he can earn more money from his current business and save the additional amount for reinvestment.

loan.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of basic goods to stock his general store

loan.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is 39 years old and has three children, one daughter and two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hang and her husband have been running a food stall for thirteen years. They sell noodles to people in the local community. She would like a 15,000,000 VND loan from CEP to buy furniture to place around her stall, bowls, chopsticks and meat to expand her business and meet her customers' demands.

Hang hopes that through this loan she can earn more money and save more for reinvestment.

loan.use: To buy furniture, bowls, chopsticks and meat for her stall.

loan.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is fifty years old, married, and has a daughter. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband who is a driver for hire. She earns money by operating a beauty shop and selling soft drinks in front of her house.

Huong is requesting a 15,000,000 VND loan from CEP that she will use to purchase a greater range and quantity of soft drinks and some cosmetics for her salon. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers.

Through her loan Huong hopes she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loan.use: to buy soft drinks to sell and cosmetics for her salon.

loan.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Xuan is a 61-year-old married woman with four children, three daughters and one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh city.

Twelve years ago, Xuan established a stall to sell soft drinks to the local community. She plans to get a 10,000,000 loan from CEP to invest in her business by purchasing a greater quantity of beverages to stock her stall.

Xuan hopes that this will both enable her to attract more customers and help her to earn more income, so improving her family's living conditions.

loan.use: To purchase a greater quantity of beverages to stock her stall.

loan.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung is 35 years old and married with two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.
Hung supports his family with the income that he earns selling crab noodle soup. His wife also helps him to manage the business, which they started ten years ago. Hung intends to use his loan to buy good quality materials to cook a greater quantity of soup to sell. He hopes his business will run smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loan.use: to buy good quality materials to cook crab noodle soup to sell.

loan.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 47-year-old woman. She and her husband make money by sewing clothes, and they have done this for ten years. They have two daughters and live together in Ho Chi Minh City.
Huong would like to take out a loan to buy sewing materials and fabrics. This will increase her productive capacity and allow her to make more clothing. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her children's education.

loan.use: to buy sewing materials and fabrics.

loan.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is a 36-year-old married woman. She has two sons and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living as a worker.
Van has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop at her house. She has been in business for twenty years.
She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loan.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish.

loan.name: Teu

texts.en: Mr.Teu is a 30-year-old married man who lives with humble wife and his four lovely children, located in Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia. It's a zone where agribusiness is common; the majority of the region's inhabitants are rice, cattle and fishing business. Nowadays, he is a lovely father who generates a kind of job as rice business. He is a responsible person that always takes care about livelihood, and providing a good education to his children. He is married to his wife who runs a type of business alongside him.Mr.Teu has been involving with this business sector for long time ago, so it is long periods of him related this field. Due to the long time, it is easy way for him to get more experiences and get more outcomes every year. To upgrade a living in a better quality of life, he and his wife would like to purchase a cow but they dont have enough money yet, so they are seeking for kind lenders who famous helpers to support their family in time. They are expecting that this loan will make their family meet happiness and prosperity. They are very thanks to all lenders who always help to poor family.

loan.use: to purchase a cow.

loan.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is a 48-year-old woman. She is single and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Ly earns an income by sewing clothing. She has done this for eight years.
Ly would like to take out a loan to buy sewing materials and fabrics. This will increase her productive capacity and allow her to create a larger amount of clothing. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her family.

loan.use: to buy sewing materials and fabrics.

loan.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is a 42-year-old married woman. She has a son and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living as a worker.
Thu has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop to serve people in her community. She has been in business for 15 years.
She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loan.use: To buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish.

loan.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is 44 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a worker for a nearby company.
For 10 years, Ha has earned a living by running a general store. She would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, candies, and soft drinks, to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income, which would help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loan.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, candies, and soft drinks to stock her store.

loan.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 60-year-old married woman. She lives with her four children and husband in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have run a shop in front of their house for the past nine years. They sell insecticides and fertilizer.
Hoa would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a larger quantity of products to meet her customers' demands. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loan.use: To purchase a larger quantity of fertilizer and insecticides to sell

loan.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is a 36-year-old woman. She is married with a daughter and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Loan and her husband earn an income by selling soft drinks in front of their house. She has done this since 2010.
Loan would like to take out a loan to buy a larger quantity of beverages to stock her store. This will allow her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her family.

loan.use: To buy a larger quantity of beverages to stock her store.

loan.name: Zarif

texts.en: Zarif is married and the responsible father of two children. He is a very hard-working and kind man. With great effort and hardship, he managed to open his own business, at which he is now very successful. He has been working in animal husbandry for more than ten years. He currently owns one dairy cow and one calf. He sells his cattle at the market and receives a good income. He keeps his cattle in good living conditions and has food for them. Zarif is requesting a loan to buy additional cattle and feed. He looks forward to your help and kindness.

loan.use: To buy cattle and cattle feed

loan.name: Dilnoza

texts.en: Dilnoza has been raising cattle for over eight years. She breeds the cattle and sells it. Dilnoza is 28 years old and has a child. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase animal feed.

loan.use: to buy animal feed

loan.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 38-year-old woman. She is the mother of two children. She lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a mechanic. She earns an income by running a general store in front of her house. She has done this since 2007.
Huong would like to take out a loan to buy a larger quantity of products such as instant food, ice cream, drinking water and many kinds of basic items to sell to her customers. This will allow her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her children's education.

loan.use: To buy a larger quantity of products such as instant food, ice cream, drinking water and many kinds of basic items to sell

loan.name: Nao

texts.en:
Nao is a 56-year-old woman. She is the mother of four children. She lives with her children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a bricklayer. She earns an income by cooking and selling steamed glutinous rice to her customers. She has done this since 2006.
Nao would like to take out a loan to buy good quality ingredients to cook a better food for selling. This will increase her production capacity and allow her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her family.

loan.use: To buy good quality ingredients to cook better food to sell

loan.name: Tuoi

texts.en:
Tuoi and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 48 and has four sons. Her husband earns an income as a truck driver.
Tuoi has been earning a living by operating a general store from the door of their house for the past seven years. She sells a variety of basic goods such as sugar, confectioneries, and basic household necessities.
Tuoi would like to borrow money to expand her business and hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loan.use: to purchase a variety of basic goods and household necessities to sell

loan.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is a 58-year-old woman. She is the mother of three children. She lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband manage a mechanics shop at their house. She has done this since 2003.
Anh would like to take out a loan to buy work tools and materials for her business. This will increase her productive capacity and allow her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her family.

loan.use: To buy working tools and materials for her mechanics shop.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy a greater variety of products such as food and beverages.

loan.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 39 and has three children. She and her husband earn a living by running a laundry business. They started the business four years ago.
Anh would like to borrow money in order to expand the business by buying detergent and good quality laundry equipment. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loan.use: to expand her business by buying detergent and good quality equipment for her laundry.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to construct a house for his small family.

loan.name: Xinh

texts.en:
Xinh and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 39 years old and has two children. Xinh and her husband have been earning a living by operating a general store from the front of her house for the past ten years. They sell a variety of goods, such as sugar, candies, basic household necessities, beverages and rice.
Xinh would like to borrow money in order to expand her business by purchasing more products in bulk for the coming holiday season. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loan.use: to purchase more products in bulk for the coming holiday season.

loan.name: El Tesoro Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama el tesoro y se integra de tres seores quienes se dedican a su respectiva actividad
La seora Glafira es casa con el seor Adolfo y con quien procreo tres hijos quienes ya estn casados. Ella solito el prstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: azcar, harina, aceite, huevo, entre otros para la elaboracin de pan en donde lleva trabajando seis aos y le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido buenos ingresos para su hogar. Comenz por su propia creatividad ya que tambin quiere apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y su familia. Lo que desea su actividad es poder tener un horno ms grande para seguir trabajado como ella le gusto Las personas que integran en el grupo son: Gloria Isabel quine invertir el prstamo en la compra de ingredientes para su taquera y don Abinael quine invertir el prstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboracin de tamales.
texts.en:
The group is called, "El Tesoro," and is made up of three people who work in their respective livelihoods. Glafira is married to Adolfo, and they have three children who are already married. She applied for the loan in order to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour, cooking oil, eggs, and other things for making bread.
She has been working at this for six years and it's going well, as she has had good income for her household. She began it through her own creativity, as she also wanted to support her husband with income for their home and family. What she wishes for her business is to have a larger oven, in order to continue working the way she likes.
The people making up the group are: Gloria Isabel who will use the loan to buy ingredients for her taco stand, and Abinael who will use the loan to buy ingredients for making tamales.

loan.use: To buy ingredients for making bread.

loan.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is 52 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband is retired. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.
Hai operates a food stall in front of her house. She has been in business for 12 years. She sells meals to people in her community. She plans to take a loan to repair her stall and purchase good quality food to sell. Hai hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers during the coming holiday season.
She hopes that through this loan she will be able to generate additional income to reinvest in her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loan.use: to repair her stall and purchase good quality food to sell.

loan.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh is 51 years old and married. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two sons.
Her husband works as a seasonal worker. Khanh earns money by running a general store in front of her house. She sells many types of goods including confectionery, fast food and basic necessities to people in the local community. She has run the shop for six years.
Khanh intends to take a loan in order to purchase a greater variety of general goods to sell to her customers. She hopes that, through the loan, her business will generate additional income to pay for her familys expenses.

loan.use: to purchase a greater variety of general goods to sell to her customers.

loan.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc, a 36-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two sons. Her husband earns an income working as a truck driver. Ngoc runs a general store that sells a variety of basic goods and many kinds of vegetables to people in the local community. She started this business ten years ago.
Ngoc requires a loan to purchase a range of different products, including basic packaged foods and many kinds of vegetables, to meet her customers' demand. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to support her children.

loan.use: to purchase a range of different general store products to meet her customers' demand.

loan.name: Tinh

texts.en:
Tinh is 56 years old and married. He lives with six children and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City.
He and his wife earn a living operating a store from their house that sells basic household necessities to the people in their community. They have done this for the past eight years.
Tinh would like to take out a loan to invest in his store by buying a greater variety and quantity of basic goods. This will enable him to provide more products for his customers, generate more income to cover his family's living expenses, and reinvest in the business.

loan.use: to buy basic household necessities to stock his general store.

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
Josephine is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tools and gasoline for their motorcycle services.
Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy tools and gasoline for her motorcycle service.

loan.name: Nghia

texts.en:
Nghia is 37 years old; he is married and has three daughters. He supports his family by selling food from a stall in front of his house. He sells meals, such as rice with grilled pork and noodles, to people in his community. His wife helps him to manage their food stall. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.
Nghia intends to take out a loan to buy more food of better quality to sell from his stall and attract additional customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and helps him to improve his living conditions.

loan.use: to buy food to sell from his stall.

loan.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is 22 years old and single. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.
For the past three years, he has been earning a living operating an internet and game business at his house.
Hien would like to take out a loan to buy more computers and games for his business. He hopes the loan will help him to provide better services, generate more income to cover his family's living expenses, and reinvest in his business.

loan.use: to buy more computers and games for his business.

loan.name: Iane Ixara

texts.en: Iane Ixara is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single, with 2 children. Iane Ixara has a shop that sells beauty & personal hygiene products from AVON. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock from AVON to sell. Iane Ixara has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Iane Ixara hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stock from AVON to sell

loan.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. Erlinda has a shop that sells beauty & personal hygiene products from AVON. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy stock from AVON to sell. Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stock from AVON to sell

loan.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 31 years old. She is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver for hire.
Dung has earned money by running a general store at her house for four years. Dung intends to use her loan to buy more kinds of products, such as instant food, confectionery, and shampoo to sell from her general store. She hopes that her business runs smoothly, and that this will help to improve her family's living conditions and provide additional income to pay for the eduction of her children.

loan.use: To buy more kinds of products, such as instant food, confectionery, and shampoo to sell from her general store.

loan.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Rebecca has a food shop (sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loan.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 51, is married and has two daughters. She earns a living to support her family by sewing clothes. Her husband works as a security guard. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.
Yen started her business making clothing twenty years ago. She would like to take a loan to expand the business. With the loan she intends to increase her working capital by buying good materials that will enable her to make better-quality clothes for her customers. She hopes that this will generate more income and that she can save for her children's education.

loan.use: To buy good materials that will enable her to make better quality clothes for her customers.

loan.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien, a 65-year-old married man, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He has 8 children. He and his wife run a clothing shop at their house. They started this business ten years ago.
Tien requires a loan to expand his business by purchasing fabrics and good quality materials to increase his production of clothes. This will enable him to offer a better range of clothes to his customers. He hopes his business will run smoothly and he can earn additional income to support his family.

loan.use: To purchase fabric and good quality materials to increase his production of clothes.

loan.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en: Ma. Victoria is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Ma. Victoria is providing videoke or karaoke services where customers pay 5 pesos per song. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools &to pay for the electricity for the services. Ma. Victoria has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ma.Victoria hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy tools & to pay for the electricity for the services

loan.name: Maricar

texts.en: Maricar is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Maricar has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Maricar has been a member of HSPFI. In the future, Maricar hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loan.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama santo Domingo y se integra de tres seoras quien cada una se dedica a su respectiva actividad.
Quien se le tomo la entrevista es Araley, ella vive en unin libre con el seor Leonardo y con quien procreo dos hijos que aun estn a su responsabilidad.
Ella solito el prstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: aceite, carne, pasas, chile ancho, maz para la elaboracin de tamales, ella lleva con ste negocio un ao seis meses y comenta que le va bien y que con ello ha mejorado mucho sus ingresos en su hogar.
Inicio por si sola para poyara su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y as sacar adelante a sus hijos pequeos que a un dependen d ella.
Lo que desea del prstamo es poder seguir trabajando para as darle lo mas necesario a su familia que es lo ms importante para ella. Las personas que integran en el grupo son: la seora Yolanda quien invertir en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboracin de tacos y Karla yesenia invertir en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboracin de comidas.
texts.en:
The group is called Santo Domingo and it is made up of three ladies who each do their own job.
Araley was interviewed. She lives with her partner Seor Leonardo, with whom she has two children who are still dependent on them.
She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as: oil, meat, raisins, ancho chiles and corn to make tamales. She has been working in this business for a year and a half and she says that it is going very well for her and that it has helped her to improve the family income.
She began by herself in order to help her husband with the household income, thus getting her small, dependent children ahead in life.
Through the loan, she would like to be able to continue working to provide her family with what they need, which is the most important thing for her.
The people who make up the group are: Seora Yolanda who will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make tacos and Karla Yesenia will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make meals.

loan.use: to pay for ingredients to make tamales.

loan.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Mercedita has a shop that sells computer accessories & school supplies. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stock, such as computer accessories & school supplies. Mercedita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mercedita hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stock, like computer accessories & school supplies

loan.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es:
La seora Mara Elisa es casada vive en unin libre con el seor Ral y con quien procreo tres hijos que un estn a su responsabilidad y vive en un localidad pequea.
El prstamo que ella solito es para invertirlo en la compra y venta de pollo para luego venderlo destazado en donde lleva trabajando ocho aos y comenta que le va bien.
Inicio por si solo ya que tambin quiere apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y as sacar adelante a su familia y no les haga falta lo necesario.
Lo que ella desea es que con el prstamo ella pueda seguir trabajando y mejorando cada da sus ingresos de su hogar y salir adelante con su pequea familia.
Las personas que integran en el grupo son: Zoraida invertir el prstamo en la compra de productos agrcolas y don scar Alberto invertir en la compra de mercanca para su negocio de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mara Elisa is in a common law marriage with Ral. They have three children and live in a small town.
The loan she asked for is to invest in buying chickens to butcher and sell. She has been doing this for eight years and says that it is going well.
She started on her own since she wants to help her husband with the household expenses and thus get their family ahead so they won't lack anything they need.
What she wants with the loan is to keep working and improving every day with her household income and to get ahead with her small family.
The people who make up the group are: Zoraida, who will invest in buying agricultural products and Oscar Alberto, who will invest in buying merchandise for her grocery business.

loan.use: to buy chickens to butcher and sell.

loan.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Flordeliza is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline for the services. Flordeliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline for the services

loan.name: La Buchicata Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama La Buchicata esta conformado por once integrantes todas personas trabajadoras que desde pequeas han sabido lo que es ganarse el pan de cada da y ganarse el amor de sus familias con esfuerzo. El representante de este grupo es el seor Jacinto mejor conocido como Don Chinto por sus compaeras del grupo. Don Chinto es un seor de cincuenta y dos aos de edad , que desde pequeo a trabajado comenz a trabajar en una tienda de abarrotes y siempre quiso tener su propia tienda as que trabajo y ahorro para poder tener una tienda pequea y gracias a sus ganancias pudo hacerla crecer y ser su propio jefe. El pidi el prstamo para comprar mas mercanca de abarrotes como es : galletas ,javon,caf.leche,galletas, refrescos, yogurt, jugos y licuados. Las otras integrantes de el grupo son: Rufa-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa. Tomasa-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos. Florida Martha-quien se dedica al de lavado de autos. Norma Elena -quien se dedica a la venta de ropa. Maribel-quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Mara de la Paz-quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Tereza-quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Rosa Mara-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa. Elizabeth-quien se dedica a la venta de articulos artesanales. Sarai-quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Le dan las gracias a fundacin por ayudarla a salir adelante y darle la oportunidad de cumplir sus sueos con su ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is called 'La Buchicata'. It has 11 members. They are all hard-working people who, since they were very young, have known what it means to earn their daily bread and earn the love of their families through hard work. The group's representative is Jacinto, who is better known as Don Chinto by his fellow group members.
Don Chinto is a 52-year-old man who has been working since he was very young. He started out working in a grocery store and always wanted his own store. He worked and saved so that he could own his own small store and, thanks to the profits he made, he was able to grow the business and become his own boss.
Don Chinto requested this loan to buy more groceries such as cookies, soap, coffee, milk, soft drinks, yogurt, juices and shakes.
The other members of this group are: Rufa - who sells clothing Tomasa - who sells Mexican snacks Florida Martha - who washes cars Norma Elena - who sells clothing Maribel - who sells groceries Mara de la Paz - who sells groceries Tereza - who sells groceries Rosa Mara - who sells clothing Elizabeth - who sells handicrafts Sarai - who sells groceries.
The group's members thank Fundacin Realidad for helping them to get ahead in life and for giving them the opportunity to fulfill their dreams.

loan.use: to buy groceries to sell

loan.name: Noche Buena Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama noche buena y se integra de cuatro seoras quienes se dedican a: Mara Efrocinia y Fabiola Patricia invertirn en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboracin de panes, la seora Betzaida en la compra y venta de ganados Y Adelina quien vende tamales.
Adelina ella vive en unin libre con el seor Alberto y con quien procreo seis hijos que an estn a su responsabilidad y estn estudiando.
El prstamo que ella solicito es para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: maz, aceite, carne, pasas, entre otros para la elaboracin de tamales en donde lleva trabajando un ao cinco meses y la va bien ya que con ello ha logrado mejorar mucho sus ingresos.
Ella inicio con esta actividad ya que tambin quiere apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y as sacar adelante a su pequea familia que es lo ms importante para ella darle lo ms necesario.
Lo que ms desea de su actividad es que sus ingresos mejores para a horrar y comprar ollas para cocinar los tamales y as darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group is called Noche Buena and it is made up of four women who work in the following: Mara Efrocinia and Fabiola Patricia will invest in buying ingredients to make bread, Betzaida in buying and selling cattle, and Adelina, who sells tamales.
Adelina is in a common law marriage with Alberto, with whom she has six children whom they are still raising and who are in school.
The loan she asked for is to invest in buying ingredients such as: corn, oil, meat, raisins and more to make tamales. She has been doing this for a year and five months and it is going well for her, since she has improved her income a lot.
She started this activity because she wanted to help her husband with the household income and get their little family ahead. Giving them what they need is the most important thing for her.
What she wants the most from her activity is better income so she can save and buy pots to cook the tamales and give her customers a better service.

loan.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales.

loan.name: Exaltacion Group

texts.es: La seora Elizabeth tiene 28 aos de edad ella vive en unin libre con su esposo, ella tiene 3 hijas 2 de sus hijas estudian la primaria y otra esta pequea no estudia, ella vende tortas y tacos de bistec, ella solicito su prstamo para comprar servilletas, bolsas, manteles de plstico, verduras, carnes, jitomates, cebolla, queso chiles, mayonesa, pepinos, rbanos, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 aos, era de su mama y se lo dejo, su negocio es importante porque tiene un ingreso extra, ella se siente orgullosa de vender y que ya no le da pena vender y se sabe valer por ella misma, ella saca su puesto los sbados y domingos sus clientes son los turistas ya que su comunidad es un lugar bonito hay artesanas y elaboran el barro hacen ollas, cazuelas y adornos de barro, ella utiliza las ganancias para comprar cosas para su casa y para comprarles a sus hijas zapatos y ropa. Sus sueos y esperanzas son seguir ampliando su negocio hasta donde ella pueda, que sus hijas sigan estudiando de su negocio lo puede lograr aprovechar, ahorrar y no mal gastar. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundacin Realidad "gracias por sus prestamos, por confiar en nosotros y lo vamos a aprovechar para crecer los negocios, para el futuro de la familia y no les vamos a defraudar, muchas gracias".
texts.en:
Seora Elizabeth is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and she has 3 daughters. Two of her daughters are in primary school and the other is small and doesnt go to school. Elizabeth sells steak sandwiches and tacos. She is requesting a loan to buy napkins, bags, plastic tablecloths, vegetables, meat, tomatoes, onions, cheese, mayonnaise, cucumbers and radishes. She started her business 2 years ago. It was her mothers and she left it to her. Her business is important because it provides extra income. She is proud of selling, that it comes easier now and that she can look after herself. She takes her stall out on Saturdays and Sundays. Her customers are tourists as her community is a beautiful place, where clay is produced and pots, casserole dishes and ornaments are made out of clay. She uses her profits to buy things for her house and to buy clothes and shoes for her daughters. Her hopes and dreams are to continue expanding her business as much as she can, that her daughters continue studying and that she will make the most of her business, save and spend wisely.
The members of the group would like to say the following to Kiva and Fundacin Realidad Thank you for the loans, and for trusting us. We are going to make the most of the loans in order to grow our businesses for the future of our families and we will not disappoint you. Thank you very much.

loan.use: to buy napkins, bags, plastic tablecloths, vegetables, meat, tomatoes, onions, cheese, mayonnaise, cucumbers and radishes

loan.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 52 years old and is married to Mumbua. They are blessed with three children. Solomon has been running a retail shop for the past three years, with a monthly income of Kes 30,000, which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd. of Kes 20,000, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy stock of sugar and rice for his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loan.use: To buy stock of sugar and rice for his shop.

loan.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en: Ilhomjon is married and the loving father of two children. His children are still small and his wife watches after them. Five years ago Ilhomjon began raising cattle for the sake of supporting his children. At the beginning, he only had one, but with time he expanded his business and now he has four head of cattle. Now, with the goal of expanding his business, he would like to add several head more.

loan.use: To buy cattle

loan.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 36 years old with four children. He has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 30,000 which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20,000 after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy stock of sugar and rice for his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.
His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loan.use: To buy stock of sugar and rice for his shop.

loan.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 25 years old, married to Alice, and they are blessed with one child aged 3 years. He has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 30,000 which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20,000 after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy stock of sugar and rice for his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.
His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loan.use: To buy stock of sugar and rice for his shop

loan.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Mercedes works hard to support her family.
She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Mercedes is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.
Mercedes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loan.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her general store

loan.name: Ma. Rosa

texts.en:
Ma. Rosa is 47 years old and married with seven children.
Ma. Rosa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snacks, rice grains and other miscellaneous items.
Ma. Rosa has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 5 years and also earns additional income from her rice and corn retail business.
Ma. Rosa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loan.use: to buy more items like snacks, rice grains, and other miscellaneous items.

loan.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old, married to Mary, and they are blessed with one child aged 12 years. Peter has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 5,000 which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 10,000 after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.
His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing.

loan.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loan.name: Harun

texts.en: Harun is a 45 year old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be quiet and likes sharing ideas. He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, blue band (margarine), stationery etc. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a commercial area within a busy market. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sodas and paper bags. Harun's business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more sodas and paper bags.

loan.name: Jalolidin

texts.en: Jalolidin lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 42 years old and has four children. His wife is a teacher. Jalolidin provides taxi service and has done this for four years. He is taking out a loan for car repairs and to install a natural gas conversion kit.

loan.use: to install a natural gas conversion kit

loan.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.
Delia requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.
Delia has been in this business for 10 years now.
In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: To buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loan.name: David

texts.en:
David is 41 years old, married to Virginia, and they are blessed with one child. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 5,000 which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 10,000 after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.
His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing.

loan.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loan.name: Hoem

texts.en: Mrs. Hoem is in the business of planting rice crops in Prey Chor district, where she grew up and has lived for ages. She is married with two single children. All of her children are students who completely depend on her income. Hoem is able to grow her rice crops twice a year depending to the source of water from the nearby river. However, she is still in a low income group because at the present, she has rented some pieces of farmland for her farming project. She intends to own a few plots of farmland herself if she has enough funds to purchase them from her neighbors. Agriculture is the sole source of her income. Recently, Hoem has requested a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to pay farmland fees. This loan will sustain her business, moving forwards and saving her family out of hunger. She is very happy and thankful to all lenders.

loan.use: to pay farmland fees.

loan.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 49 years old, married to Ciriaka, and they are blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of Kes 5,000 which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 10,000 after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.
His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing.

loan.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loan.name: Mohitobon

texts.en: Mohitobon lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 45 years old, married and has three children. Her son lives in the Russian Federation. She is engaged in sewing. Primarily, Mohitobon sews bedspreads. She is taking out a loan to buy fabric.

loan.use: to buy fabric

loan.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 57 years and widowed, with five children. She has been in the farming business for the past six years, with a monthly income of Kes 15,000 which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 57,266 after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Purity will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business for she will educate her children.
Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loan.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gemma is 47 years old and 2 of her children are in school.
Gemma has a business buying and selling beauty products in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.
Gemma has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her 2 children to college.

loan.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loan.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 44 years old, married to Ndirangu, and they are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes10,000 which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 57,266 after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Catherine will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business for she will educate her children.
Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loan.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 38 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be social and focused.
Miriam operates a retail store where she provides tailoring services and sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located within a local market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of material. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more materials for clothes.
Miriam's business goal is to own more machines for sewing clothes within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more cloth and materials for sewing dresses.

loan.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 51 years old, married to Nicholas, and they are blessed with four children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes10,000 which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 57,266 and she will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.
Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loan.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Khosiyat is smart and honest. She and her husband are engaged in growing crops and fattening cattle, sheep and goats. They have four children and all of them are hard working adults. The family is striving to work diligently to create a better life for themselves.
On their land they grow crops and the plant material left after the harvest is used as fodder for the cattle. Khosiyat would like to take out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, fuel, and to pay hired help. She is relying on your help and charity.

loan.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel

loan.name: Phory

texts.en:
Phory (in the photo) and her husband, Tian, are teachers. When free from teaching, they also run a weaving business at home. They have been married since 1990 and have no children yet. They live on an island in the Mekong River about15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Phory is asking for a loan of $500 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loan.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loan.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur is a wonderful and caring family man. He is the father of three children and his wife takes care of the home. In order to support his family he has been engaged in business for many years. He began his business with buying and selling fruits and vegetables. Later he moved on to growing potatoes, garlic, peanuts, and wheat.
This is already his fifth year with a good income from this business. He would like to take a loan for 2000 somoni to buy seeds, fuel, mineral fertilizers, and to pay his hired workers. He is relying on your goodness and support.

loan.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loan.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is 40 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for two years.
Yar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loan.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loan.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 24 years old and married to Rosemary. They have one child. He has been in the welding business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 11,500.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000, He will use the funds to purchase more stock of welding rods and metal bars .With the anticipated profits, he will save to improve his living standards.
His hopes and dreams are to have a stable business (self-sustaining) and provide the basic needs of his family.

loan.use: To purchase welding rods and metal bars

loan.name: Nhoeb

texts.en: Mrs. Nhoeb is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She permanently lives in Takhmao town where she grows rice and vegetables with her husband. She is able to make around $4.00 per day. She describes herself as a low-educated woman. However she really loves and enjoys her farming business because it enables her to provide her children with a good education for the future. This is her second loan from HKL and she will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to ensure her crops grow well. She hopes that she will be able to generate a good output and earn extra income to improve her living conditions.

loan.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loan.name: Lors

texts.en: Mrs. Lors is an honest client of HKL and this is her third loan from our MFI. With the previous loans, Lors has never made a late payment and has repaid successfully. The purpose of this loan is to construct a small house for her married child. Her other two children are single and live with her in Dongkor commune. Lors presently has been involved in a farming project. She cultivates rice to earn a living, while her husband shares his responsibility for the family by providing construction services from place to place. In the future, Lors aims to open a seamstress shop for her single daughter who is now working for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city.

loan.use: to construct a small house for her married child.

loan.name: Coleta

texts.en:
Coleta is 36 years old and is married to Mutunga. They have two children. She has been selling timber and firewood for the past 13 years with a monthly income of Kes 8700.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20, 000. She will use the funds to purchase stock of timber and firewood for her business. With the anticipated profits she will educate her children.
Her hopes and dreams are to offer her customers the best and to take care of her family

loan.use: To purchase stock of timber and firewood

loan.name: Ajur

texts.en: Ajur is a 33-year-old married woman with six children: three of them are in school. She has run a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years. Ajur is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income to pay her children's school fees.

loan.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loan.name: Muthaisu

texts.en: Muthaisu is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 to 11 years. She describes herself as quiet and likes sharing ideas. She operates a grocery store where she sells potatoes, tomatoes, mangoes and kales. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located along a busy road. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more potatoes and cabbages. Her business goal is to run many more green grocery stores within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more potatoes and cabbages.

loan.name: Athiong

texts.en: Athiong is a 39-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has run a charcoal selling business in Bor South Sudan for two years. Athiong is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income to pay school fees.

loan.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loan.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth is a married woman. She has a son who is 21 years old. She describes herself as strong and determined. She operates a clothes retail store. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of clothes. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes and to add stock of new shoes for sale. Beth's business goal is to own another clothes retail shop, near her estate, within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for resale

loan.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 38 years old and is married to Daniel. They have 3 children. She has been practising dairy farming for the past 2 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 9000.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20,000. She will use the loan to purchase dairy feeds. With the anticipated profits she will also venture into vegetable cultivation.
Her hopes and dreams are to purchase more dairy cows and to cater for her basic needs.

loan.use: To purchase dairy feeds

loan.name: Agau

texts.en: Agau is a 47-year-old married woman with six children, all of whom are in school. She has run a charcoal selling business in Bor, South Sudan for three years. Agau is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income to build a house.

loan.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loan.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 10 to 25 years. She describes herself as strong and determined. She operates a general store where she sells items such as soap and stationery. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in an area which is good for business. She describes her biggest business challenge as unfavourable climate change. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stationery and soap. Jenifer's business goal is to run another general store near her town within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more stationery and soaps.

loan.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 49 years old and is married to Davson. They have three children. She has been running a retail shop for the past 11 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 8000.
She is requesting her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20000. She will use the funds to purchase stock of sugar, salt, soda and rice. With the anticipated profits, she will educate her kids.
Her hopes and dreams are to venture into dairy farming.

loan.use: to purchase stock of sugar, salt, soda and rice

loan.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a baker at Mpredwo. She finished middle form 3. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a pensioner. Ama has been baking for some time now and is responsible for supporting her husband in feeding their children. Her loan will be used to buy flour and sugar. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy flour and sugar for her bakery

loan.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Bobby is a 42-year-old, married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He has 4 children aged between 10 and 17.
Bobby has been a farmer for 6 years. He tills his own land to grow rice crops to sell. He earns 31,000 php per harvest and is able to feed his family and send his children to school through his business. He works hard to improve his earnings and to save for his children's college education.
Bobby has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. He hopes that this loan will help increase his harvest.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs

loan.name: Yu

texts.en:
Mrs.Yu is a 54-year-old married woman who lives with her three lovely kids in the Prey Chor district of Kampong Charm province, Cambodia. One of her kids is married and lives in a separate house. She is a loving mother who has been running a rice business since 1972. She is responsible and always takes care to provide a livelihood and a good education for her children.
She can earn enough profit per day to cover her family expenses. To improve their quality of life, she would like to purchase more rice to sell when she can get a high price. She does not have enough capital for this so she has decided to apply for a loan through HKL partner with Kiva. She says that having this support for her business will make her family live in comfort, happiness and prosperity. Moreover, she is commited to paying back the kind lenders punctually. She is very thankful to all the donors who will help her family avoid poverty. This is the first cycle of her loan with HKL. She does not use any other state bank outside of HKL because it is the one micro-finance organisation that provides lower interest, good services and long term periods.

loan.use: to purchase rice.

loan.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has 2 children aged 2 months and 3 years. She describes herself as flexible. She operates a food stall where she sells fish and sardines. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a competitive and busy area. She describes her biggest business challenges as increasing travel costs and shortages of fish. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy one basin of sardines and one bundle of dried fish. Her business goal is to buy a fridge within 5 years. Eunice hopes that, in the future, she will be exporting fish.

loan.use: To buy one basin of sardines and a bundle of dried fish

loan.name: Abul

texts.en: Abul is a 39-year-old, married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has run a charcoal selling business in Bor, South Sudan for three years. Abul is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loan.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loan.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 24-year-old married woman. She has 6 children aged from 5 to 18 years. She describes herself as kind and welcoming. She operates a retail clothes business where she sells clothing material. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a very busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of security. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothing materials. Her business goal is to venture into a retail store within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more clothing materials.

loan.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with 3 school-aged children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.
Cecilia owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar and spices. Cecilia also grows ducks and sells fresh fish to her neighbors. Cecilia works hard to help provide for her family and to send her children to school. She plans to use her loan to buy duck feed, more fish and items to sell such as canned goods.
In the future, Cecilia hopes for her children to be successful.

loan.use: to buy duck feed, more fish and items to sell such as canned goods

loan.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is 39 years old and is married to Mutiso. They have two children. She has been a dairy farmer for the past 3 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 8,600.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20,000. She will use the funds to purchase dairy feeds (molasses, hay and Napier grass) for her cows. With the anticipated profits, she will improve her family's living standards.
Her hopes and dreams are to improve the quality of breeds for her dairy cattle and to achieve financial stability.

loan.use: To purchase dairy feeds

loan.name: Cruy

texts.en: Mrs. Cruy is shown in the photo in front of her house in Prey Chor district. She has been involved in an agricultural business, growing rice. She is now 52 years old and has seven children. 4 of them are married and lived independently. Mrs. Cruy would like to ask for a loan from HKL to buy timber to elevate her house to a higher position. She is very happy that the loan will be granted to fix her house. In the future, she plans to buy extra farmland to increase her rice output.

loan.use: to buy timber to elevate her house to a higher position.

loan.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia is a 26-year-old, married woman. She describes herself as flexible and determined. She operates a retail store where she sells second hand clothes, commonly known as 'mitumba'. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at a very busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge as low purchasing power when a certain type of clothing goes out of fashion. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy a bale of clothes. Olivia's business goal is to run a boutique and venture into a new retail shop business within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy two bales of clothes to sell

loan.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 53-year-old, married woman with 7 children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.
Delia works in a fishing business. Her husband operates their fishing boat and Delia sells his catch at the market. Delia and her husband work together to provide food, clothes and other basic needs. Delia works hard to keep her family healthy and happy.
She has requested this loan to purchase additional fishing nets, hooks and other materials. This will help Delia and her husband to have more fish to sell.

loan.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, hooks and other materials

loan.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 68 years old and is married to Ngila. They have four children. She has been operating a small scale poultry farm for the past 16 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 5000.
She is applying for her sixteenth loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20,000. She will use the funds to purchase chicken and poultry feeds. With the anticipated profits she will pay her children's school fees.
Her hopes and dreams are to have a large scale poultry farm.

loan.use: To buy extra chicken and poultry feeds

loan.name: Twisununure Group

texts.fr:
Antoinette fait partie du groupe Twisununure. Elle habite Gitega, elle a 48 ans. Elle est marie Venant un tailleur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants qui ont termin lcole primaire.
Elle est commerante de boisson locale depuis 3ans.
Elle est son quatrime crdit avec Turame.Avec le crdit KIVA quelle obtient,elle va augmenter son capital,en achetant une grande quantit de litres de boisson locale revendre pour gagner plus.
Avec les benefices, elle pourra amliorer sa situation familiale : achat des habits de la famille, amliorer la ration alimentaire,
texts.en:
Antoinette is part of the Twisununure group. She is 48 and lives in Gitega. She is married to Venant, a tailor. They have 6 children, who finished primary school.
She's been selling a local drink for 3 years.
This is her fourth loan with Turame. With this loan she is getting from KIVA, she will increase her capital, by buying a large quantity of the local drink which she will resell to earn more.
With the profits, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family by buying clothes, serving bigger portions of food, etc.

loan.use: to buy a large quantity of the local drink which she will resell to earn more.

loan.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is a 46-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and 2 daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family does not own their own apartment yet, but they have a mortgage from another bank to eventually own it.
Her husband works as an engineer at a local outdoor market while her oldest daughter is a teller at a commercial bank. Her younger daughter attends university in China.
Narantuya has been supporting her family by operating a beauty salon for 12 years. Previously her youngest daughter helped her mother at the salon by giving manicures and pedicures. Now that her daughter studies abroad she operates it by herself. Narantuyas salon offers body and head massages, facial treatments and eyebrow tattoos.
When she started her business in 2001, Narantuyas salon was in a small space with only one massage bed. Since then, her salon has expanded to three massage beds, with a variety of other services, in a larger space than before. The salon has an average of twenty customers per day. With this loan of 1,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT), Narantuya will purchase cosmetic products to use and to sell. The loan will hopefully allow her to expand and improve the quality of her services. The salons extra earnings will go towards her familys expenses and her familys goal of being secure in their own apartment. She is a very well trusted client of our institution.

loan.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loan.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself as honest and disciplined. He operates a retail store where he sells papers. He has been involved in this business for 3 years.
