His business is located at a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of a permanent place to operate from. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more papers to sell. Antony's business goal is to run and own a retail store, in a permanent place, within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more paper to sell

loan.name: Nyadol

texts.en: Nyadol is a 36-year-old married woman with three children who are all in school. She has run a fish selling business in Bor, South Sudan for three years. Nyadol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use the extra income to pay her children's school fees.

loan.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loan.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely is 68 years old and lives in Biasong, lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. Fely has a clay pottery business and earns approximately PHP 5,000.00 each month. She has a requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase materials for her pottery business. Fely has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. Fely hopes to save more for the future use of her family.

loan.use: To purchase materials for her pottery business

loan.name: Tamarakhan

texts.en: Tamarakhan is 61 years old, and divorced. Tamarakhan worked as an accountant at the local collective farm, and is now retired. In 1981, in search of an additional source of income for her family, Tamarakhan started her own business in animal husbandry with a starting capital of 10,000 somi (KGS). Thanks to hard work and perseverance, Tamarakhan's farm now brings in about 5,000 somi per month. To increase her quantity of livestock, Tamarakhan has come to Bitushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 somi (KGS) to purchase more livestock and forage. This will enable her to expand her farm and increase the quantity of livestock, thus making it, in her view, the best capital investment.

loan.use: to purchase livestock and forage

loan.name: Bizoza Group

texts.fr:
Beatrice fait partie du groupe Bizoza. Elle habite Gitega, et est ge de 47 ans .Elle est marie Tharcisse vendeur de lhuile de palme. Ensemble ils ont 6enfants, g de 8 22 ans. Cinq enfants tudient.
Elle est vendeuse de bire de banane depuis 20 ans.
Avec le crdit Kiva quelle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bidons de bire de banane revendre, pour gagner plus.
Le gain du business lui permettra daider son mari pour couvrir les besoins de la famille : achat des habits, du lait de beaut, aliments varis, payer les frais de scolarit des enfants. Dans les prochaines annes elle compte diversifier les produits et introduire le commerce de la bire industrielle(Primus et amstel).
texts.en:
Beatrice is part of the Bizoza group. She is 47 and lives in Gitega. She is married to Tharcisse, who is a palm oil trader. They have 6 children between the ages of 8 and 22, 5 of whom attend school.
She has been selling banana beer for 20 years.
With the loan she is getting from Kiva, she will increase her capital by buying drums of banana beer in large quantity, which she will resell to earn more.
The profits will enable her to help her husband meet the needs of their family by buying clothes, body lotion, and various food products, as well as paying for their children's school fees. In the coming years, she plans on offering a broader selection of products by branching out into the industrial beer business (Primus and Amstel).

loan.use: to buy drums of banana beer in large quantity, which she will resell to earn more.

loan.name: Merlie

texts.en: Merlie is 46 years old and lives in Buntawan, Oroquieta City. She is married with two children. Merlie has a construction supply business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month. She has a requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase stock for her sand and gravel business. Merlie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to have earned enough money to have a car and to provide for the family's needs, especially her children's education.

loan.use: to purchase stock for her sand and gravel business

loan.name: Anah

texts.en:
Anah is 35 years old and is married to Kasimbi. They have 3 children. She has been selling clothes for the past 5 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 8000.
She is requesting her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 15,000. She will use the loan to purchase stock of clothes to sell in her open market stall. With the anticipated profits she will improve her family's living standards.
Her hopes and dreams are to open a major boutique outlet in her local trading centre

loan.use: To purchase stock of clothes

loan.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 31-year-old married man. He has 6 children aged from 7 to 12 years. He describes himself as a visionary man. He operates a retail store where he sells fruit. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located at a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge as shortages of fruit. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more fruit. His business goal is to own a permanent retail store within 5 years. Peter hopes, in the future, to venture into wholesale trading.

loan.use: To buy more fruit.

loan.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 38-year-old Lebanese, married woman. She lives with her husband and three children who are all studying. Both Rima and her husband collaborate to pay their family expenses also their childrens educational fees. Rima has been working independently as a babysitter since 2005. She visits her customers at home and also welcomes some of them at her place. Her husband has been working in a local company since 1990. She is asking for a loan of $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase some nursery products related to her business. This Kiva loan will facilitate her work and allow her to attract more customers. In the future, she plans to open her own nursery.

loan.use: to purchase nursery products related to her business

loan.name: Liduena

texts.en:
Liduena is a married woman with 3 adult children. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Liduena primarily grows rice to sell. She earns about 4000 php per month. She works hard to keep her crops healthy and to have a better yield.
Liduena has requested this loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides. In the future, Liduena hopes to have a progressive business.

loan.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy more grocery and food items for sale.

loan.name: Ayen

texts.en: Ayen is a 38-year-old, married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has run a fish selling business in Bor, South Sudan for three years. Ayen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loan.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loan.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa sells saucepans at Mpredwow. She is a single parent and has 3 children. She has been selling saucepans for some time now. She uses her income in clothing and feeding their children. Her loan will be used to buy more saucepans for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy more saucepans for sale

loan.name: Kis

texts.en: Mrs. Kis runs a poultry business as well as a fish selling business to generate income. She is also a proud farmer who owns 4 hectares of farmland on which she usually grows rice in two seasons of the year. She is really busy with her daily business so she always manages her time carefully. She is now 31 years old and has been blessed with two young kids. She is asking for this loan from our lenders to buy rice seeds and 10 bags of fertilizers for her farming business. She will start planting her dry-season rice after this loan is given to her. She hopes to upgrade her standard of living someday as she strives to work hard.

loan.use: to buy rice seeds and 10 bags of fertilizers for her farming business.

loan.name: Rogelyn

texts.en:
Rogelyn is married with three children. Rogelyn is 35 years old and lives in Gumbil, Tudela.
Rogelyn is a farmer and raises livestock to earn a living. Rogelyn has been doing this for six years. Rogelyn has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase feed for her livestock business.
Rogelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rogelyn hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase feed for her livestock business

loan.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua produces palm kernel oil for sale. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been selling palm kernel oil for four years. She is responsible for assisting her husband in the general upkeep of their family. Her loan will be used to buy palm kernel for the production of her oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy palm kernel to produce oil to sell

loan.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a married man. He has two children between 9 and 12 years old. He is an intelligent man. He operates a retail store where he sells home products and paraffin. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a densely populated area. He has both repeat and new customers. His biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more wheat flour, paraffin and cooking fat. Simon's business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loan.use: To buy more wheat flour, paraffin and cooking fat

loan.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is married with two children. Romeo is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Romeo is a farmer and grows assorted crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years. He has requested a loan of 15000 to purchase fertilizers for her crop.
Romeo has been a member of PMPC for almost a year.

loan.use: To purchase fertlizers for her crop

loan.name: Amour

texts.en: Amour is 28 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for four years. Amour is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loan.use: to purchase fish to sell

loan.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with five children between 14 and 22 years old. Lorna lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Her husband works as a farmer.
Lorna is a farmer too. She and her husband work together to till their land. Rice is the main crop that they grow to sell. Each month, they earn 8,000 PHP doing this farming. Lorna plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Lorna hopes to continue earning from their farm.

loan.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loan.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is single and has four children. Esi sells gari, which she has done for 10 years. Esi uses her income to support her husband to clothe and feed their children. Esi will use the loan to purchase bags of gari to sell. With the new profits from her business, Esi plans to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase bags of gari to sell

loan.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is single and has one child. Abena is a petty trader. Some of the items she sells are tinned tomatoes and kenkey, which she has done for four years. Abena uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family. Abena will use the loan to purchase tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, soap, and other items to sell. With the new profits from her business, Abena plans to acquire a shop in which she can sell her items.

loan.use: to purchase tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, soap, and other items to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase a food warmer, plastic plates, trays and bowls to sell

loan.name: Kanguka Group

texts.en: Eugenie is 31 years old. She has 4 children between the ages of 2 and 7. Two of them attend school. Eugenie is the group leader of a group called Kanguka, which means Wake-up. The group members sell different products, but Eugenie has been selling foodstuffs for 14 years. The loan requested will be used to add more beans and sorghum for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees and make savings. In the future, she would like to own a motorcycle.

loan.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for resale.

loan.name: Bilgi

texts.en:
Bilgi is a married woman with two grown children. The younger one is 29 and the elder one is 31. She has been a Maya member for two credit cycles. She has a flower shop and has been doing this work for 4 years. She has a broad consumer group. With the first credit she used from Maya, she bought flowers to sell for mother's day. With this second credit, she will be able to sign a contract with a large firm and be able to buy flowers in bulk to fulfill orders.
When she first opened her shop, she had some financial difficulties, but she says that later, Maya provided her with many benefits. Now, Bilge has improved her business and is working with her younger son in her shop.
In the future, she wants to open new shops and support her children more. She is a very determined, honest and hardworking woman, and also an altruistic mother who dedicates her life to her children.
Translated from Turkish by Maya volunteers
Bilgi Hanm,yetikin iki ocuu olan evli bir kadn. Kk olan 29 ve byk olan 31 yanda. Bu Mayadan ald ikinci kredi. Bilgi Hanmn ieki dkkan var ve 4 yldr bu ite alyor. Geni tketici grubu var. Mayadan kulland birinci kredi ile,anneler gnnde satmak iin iek almt. kinci kredi ile, byk bir firma ile anlama yapp, bu firma iin iek getirdi. Bilgi Hanm,dkkan ilk at dnemde ve ilerleyen srelerde ,maddi konuda biraz skntlar yaam fakat ilerleyen dnemlerinde Mayadan ok fayda grdn dile getiriyor. Bu i sayesinde zaten ocuklarna destek olabilmenin yannda ilerini bytmesi ile birlikte imdi oluyla beraber almaya baladlar. Gelecekte ,yeni ubeler amak istiyor ve ocuklar ile beraber yrtmek istiyor. Bilgi hanm, azimli,drst ,kararl ve alkan bir kadn ayn zamanda tm hayatn ocuklarna adayan fedakar bir anne.

loan.use: to buy flowers.

loan.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has 4 children. She is a petty trader at Mpredwow, trading in groundnuts which she has done for 2 years. Her husband is a driver. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family. She will use the loan to purchase more groundnuts to sell. With the new profits from her business, Esi plans to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more groundnuts to sell.

loan.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has 6 children. She is a petty trader, selling saucepans and groceries at Mpredwow, which she has done for 6 years. Her husband is a miner. Esi uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more saucepans and groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more saucepans and groceries to sell.

loan.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He describes himself to be strong and determined. He operates a motorbike with which he provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a busy and competitive market. In addition, he also runs a grocery store to increase his income. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy motorbike spare parts. Daniel's business goal is to own four more motorbikes within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy motorbike spare parts.

loan.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has 2 children. She is a baker and a peddler, selling earrings, headbands, necklaces and other items at Mpredwow, which she has done for 10 years. Her husband is a mason. Abena uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family. She will use the loan to purchase necklaces, earrings, headbands and other items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to further expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase necklaces, earrings, headbands, etc. to sell.

loan.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 43 years old, married to Elizabeth, and they have four children. He has been growing and selling vegetables for the last six years, earning a monthly income of about KES 10,000.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of KES 11,000. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his vegetable farm. With the anticipated profits he will educate his children.
His hopes and dreams are to have a well managed business, to fully utilize the potential of the farm, and to have a stable family.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loan.name: Kiwambi Cha Songambele Kikuli Group

texts.en:
Atanas is 23 years old and the father of one child. He is hard-working, producing coffee, maize, cassava and beans for more than 11 years. He is facing farming problems due to lack of fertilizer and to crop disease.
Atanas is looking for funding to pay for fertilizer and insecticides. Also, he intends to increase his scale of production from 5 to 12 acres in expectation of earning more income that can be used to purchase clothes, fix his house and cover medical expenses.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides

loan.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has 3 children. She sells bush meat and also cooks banku for sale at Mpredwow, which she has done for 20 years. Her husband is a farmer. Aba uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase bush meat to sell and maize for the preparation of the banku she sells. With the new profits, Aba plans to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy bush meat to sell and maize for the preparation of the banku she sells.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more onions to sell.

loan.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman. She has 2 children, ages 3 and 7. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a favorable area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of vegetables and fruits. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. Joyce's business goal is to venture into selling cereals within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits.

loan.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is married and has eight children. He has received schooling through a scholarship. Francis sells charcoal at Asebu Brebia, which he has done for some time now. His wife is a trader.
Francis uses his income to pay his childrens school fees. Francis will use the loan to purchase an acacia plantation for charcoal. With the new profits, Francis hopes to expand his business.

loan.use: to purchase an acacia plantation for charcoal.

loan.name: Chut

texts.en:
Mrs. Chut operates a fish-selling business in a local market in the Baray district. She earns around $2.50 per day to cover household expenses. She is 33 years old and a loving mother of two school-age kids. Her husband helps contribute income for the family by working hard on the rice field and also providing motorcycle service to the people around his neighborhood.
At this time, Mrs. Chut is taking out her second loan from Kiva to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers and to pay for a plowing fee. She hopes to grow her dry-season rice as much as she can and make a good income from the output. She intends to support her two children until they graduate from a university.

loan.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers and to pay for a plowing fee.

loan.name: Rakia

texts.en:
Rakia is a single parent and has three children. Rakia makes and sells gari (a popular West African food made from cassava tubers), which she has done since age 20.
Rakia uses her income in the general upkeep of her children. Rakia will use the loan to purchase cassava tubers to product her gari for sale. With the new profit she hopes to earn, Rakia plans to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase cassava tubers to produce gari for sale.

loan.name: Duhaguruke Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 41 years old. She has four children between the ages of 6 and 21. Two of them attend school.
Beatrice is a group leader for the group called "Duhaguruke," which simply means "Let's Stand" in English. The group members do different business activities and all of them are happy with the loan given to them.
As the group leader, Beatrice has sold foodstuffs in a restaurant for the past six years. She has requested the loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell. With the profit she will save money. In the future, Beatrice would like to buy a motorcycle.

loan.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy cooking utensils and bowls to sell

loan.name: Josefina Group

texts.en:
Josefina is 42 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Poblacion, Concepcion. Josefina has a grocery store business and she earns approximately 3,600 PHP each month. She has been a member of PMPC for one year. Josefina is the leader of this two-person loan group. Although she and her partner are borrowing as a group, each of them has her own business.
Josefina is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

loan.use: to purchase stock for her grocery store

loan.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as ambitious and God-fearing. For the past 15 years, Teresia has operated an open air stall where she sells clothes. Her business is located at a convenient location and her biggest business challenge is unfavorable weather changes, especially when it is sunny.
Teresia is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to run a boutique within five years.

loan.use: to buy clothes to sell

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old and is single. For the past two years, she has been operating a retail shop and she earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES.
Rose is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, and rice for her shop. This will be her first KADET Ltd loan and she will increase her stock with her anticipated profit. Rose's hopes and dreams are to expand her business and have a wholesale store.

loan.use: to purchase rice, cooking fat, maize flour, and sugar

loan.name: Perlena

texts.en:
Perleta is 40 years old and is married with six children. She lives in Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Perleta has a fish-vending business and she earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of PMPC for five years.
Perleta is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to buy a fishing boat to provide money for her family's needs.

loan.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loan.name: Bou

texts.en:
Bou is a 33-year-old married man and a good father of one child. He is married to his wife, who runs another business alongside him. Bou works hard to support his familys daily expenditures. At present, Bou works as a farmer, which is a skill he learned from his parents. From this work, he earns a low income each day. To assist his income, Bou sells fishes at the market. He earns around US $3 per day.
Being an older brother, Bou is raising a brother who is dependent on his income. His brother wants to work as a driver for a company, but he doesnt know how to drive a car. So his brother would like to learn how to drive a car, but he doesnt have enough money to learn. So he has asked his elder brother, Bou, to apply for a loan through HKL, a partner of Kiva. Bou and his brother hope that kind lenders will lend to him.

loan.use: to learn how to drive a car.

loan.name: Kadriye

texts.en:
When Kadriye decided to start her own business, she separated from her husband. She moved in with her father because she felt it was her duty to provide the good educational support and living standards that her daughter (now 11 years old) needed. She couldnt earn enough money while working for someone else so she found a shop and rented it, but she didnt have enough money to buy the equipment she needed.
With Maya's help, she was able to purchase the equipment she needed and opened her own beauty shop. Kadriye was able to pay off her one year loan in only six months. Later on she applied for and received another loan from Maya to buy dyes, other beauty supplies, and a waxing table. She was also able to pay her second loan off early.
Kadriye is currently applying for her third loan with Maya through Kiva. With this loan, she will buy natural hair dyes, make-up products, and other beauty supplies that will help expand services and improve her beauty parlor. She has achieved a lot in the two years since starting her own business and is dedicated to keep working towards bettering it. Business is good and with this loan she believes that she will achieve her dream of expanding her business.
Translated from Turkish by Maya volunteers.
i kurmaya karar verdiinde,einden ayrlm,ayr yayordu. Birinin yannda almaktayken ekonomik olarak geimini salyamyordu. Babasnn yanna tand nk, ocuuna bakmak,okula gndermek ok zor oluyordu. yapmalyd,dkkan arad ve kiralad. Ancak,malzemeleri almas gerekiyordu fakat paras yoktu. Maya nn destei ile ,ihtiyac olan mallar temin etti,kendi gzellik dkkann at. Bir yllk kredisini 6 ayda kapatt. Sonra tekrar kredi ald, eksik olan mallarn,boyalarn,ada yatan ald.kinci kredisini de erken kapatt. Kadriye ,nc kredisini Maya aracl ile kiva tarafndan ald. imdi yeni alaca kredi ile natrel boyalarn,makyaj malzemelerini alacak. Kendi iine balad iki yldan bu yana ok yol kattetti ve zverili almasnn hep daha iyi olmas iin alt. i iyi ve bu kredi ile alan pazarda ideallerini baaracana inanyor.

loan.use: to buy natural hair dyes, make-up products, and other beauty supplies.

loan.name: Kiwambi Cha Unisa Ilela Group

texts.en:
Walter is a 50-year-old married man with seven children. Four of them attend secondary school. He has been growing coffee, maize, beans and cassava for over 10 years. He faces agricultural problems due to the lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.
Walter is working to get more funds to buy fertilizers and insecticides. He is also working hard to increase his scale of production from 7 to 15 in the coming five years with the expectation of earning more income.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loan.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 29 years old and a single mother of one child. She has been operating a retail shop for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 7,000.
She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of KES 5,000. She will use the funds to purchase stock for her shop, such as tea leaves, sugar, and maize flour. With the anticipated profits she will educate her child and provide food.
Her hope is to be financially stable.

loan.use: To buy tea leaves, sugar, and maize flour for her retail shop.

loan.name: Pum

texts.en: Pum is a garment factory worker, who resides in Takhmao town, which is a common area for local people to grow crops. Shown in the photo, Pums husband is working on his field. His photo was taken instead of his wife's because she is always away from home working all day. Typically, this couple is able to generate a good income of approximately $10 per day to satisfy their basic necessities. They do not have any children yet, but they wish to have one someday. Pum would like to obtain a loan to build a fence surrounding her house to protect it from any losses and make it a safe place to live. In the future, Pum aims to expand her husbands business and grow many crops and vegetables.

loan.use: to build a fence surrounding her house.

loan.name: Tabetta

texts.en:
Tabetta is a 34-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.
Tabetta is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more fish for resale. She will use the extra income she earns as a result of this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loan.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loan.name: Natalya

texts.en: Natalya is 36 years old, divorced, and bringing up a 10 year-old daughter. In 2002, after a difficult divorce from her spouse, Natalya realized that she needed an additional source of income for her family, aside from work as a seller at a local grocery store. Investing 20,000 som (KGS) as start-up capital, Natalya started her livestock breeding business. Currently, her business brings in approximately 8,000 som in sales of dairy and meat products. In order to further expand her business, Natalya has asked Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a cow and feed. In the future, Natalya hopes to establish a large farm.

loan.use: to purchase a cow and forage

loan.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is 52 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past seven years, she has sold snacks and food to earn a living. Constancia has been a member of PMPC for two years.
Constancia is requesting a 6,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase rice to make porridge and buy saucepans to sell

loan.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 34-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. For the past three years, she has run a fish-selling business in Bor, South Sudan.
Amer is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loan.use: to purchase fish to sell

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and married to Dominic. They have three children. For the past three years, Elizabeth has been operating a retail shop and she earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.
Elizabeth is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy stocks of tea leaves, bread, cooking oil, maize flour, and books. This will be her first loan with KADET Ltd. Elizabeth will use her anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to own a wholesale store.

loan.use: to buy tea leaves, bread, cooking oil, maize flour, and books

loan.name: Ekow

texts.en:
Ekow is a farmer who cultivates cassava to sell at at Asebu Brebia. He is single and he completed middle school form four. Ekow has been a farmer for 15 years and uses his income to pay his utilities and living expenses.
Ekow is requesting a loan to hire laborers to work on his farm. He plans to use his profit to expand his farm.

loan.use: to hire laborers to work on his farm

loan.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is a 33-year-old married woman. She has two children, who are 5 and 8 years old. She describes herself as passionate about her work. She operates a pharmacy. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds to improve the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more pharmaceutical drugs. Francisca's business goal is to be a supplier to other chemists within five years.

loan.use: To buy more pharmaceutical drugs.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: purchase bags of charcoal to resell.

loan.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort cooks rice and beans into stew which she sells at Asebu Brebia. She has completed Junior High School. Comfort is married and has four children. Her husband is a carpenter. Comfort has been selling rice and beans for three years. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and beans to cook stew to sell. With the new profit, Comfort plans to expand her business

loan.use: purchase bags of rice and beans to cook.

loan.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is a hair dresser. She operates a beauty salon at Asebu Brebia. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Theresa has been a hair dresser for the past 18 years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy to purchase wigs and hair creams. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to get a structure for her beauty salon.

loan.use: purchase wigs and hair creams.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: purchase more firewood for the production of charcoal to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers.

loan.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells charcoal and gari (cassava meal) in Asebu Brebia. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Grace has been selling gari and charcoal for 4 years. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills. Grace will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal and gari to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase bags of gari and bags of charcoal to sell.

loan.name: Kiwambi Cha Mtazamo Ilela Group

texts.en:
Sostenes is a 27-year-old father of three children, with one attending secondary education. He is good at growing coffee, maize, beans and cassava. He has been in this business for 10 years. He is facing farming problems due to lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.
Sostenes is looking for funding to buy fertilizers and insecticides. Also, he wants to expand production from 6 to 11 acres in the next five years. His expectation is to earn more income that can lead to an improved standard of living.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: purchase yams and fish to sell.

loan.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba has been producing and selling kenkey (maize dumplings) in Asebu Brebia for 15 years. She is a single parent with 3 children whom she is responsible for feeding and clothing. Aba will use her loan to purchase maize in bulk for the production of her kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to produce more kenkey to sell.

loan.use: to purchase maize in bulk for the production of her kenkey.

loan.name: Kojo

texts.en: Kojo is married and has 5 dependents. His wife is a trader. Kojo produces and sells charcoal in Asebu Brebia. Kojo uses his income for the general upkeep of his family. Kojo will use the loan to purchase more firewood for the production of charcoal to sell. With the new profits, Kojo plans to expand his business.

loan.use: to purchase more firewood for the production of charcoal.

loan.name: Integracin Group

texts.es: El comit Integracin se encuentra en el segundo ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundacin Paraguaya, tiene 12 integrantes, de la zona de Asuncin. Las mujeres integrantes del comit se esfuerzan para sacar adelante a sus familias, para que ellos puedan disponer de lo que a ellas en su niez les falto, para proveerlos de los recursos necesarios para su educacin y formacin. Maria es una de las integrantes del grupo, y ella nos cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo tiene una despensa, la cual empez con una pequea inversin, pero hoy en da ya tiene un buen negocio bien surtido. Su deseo es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia. En miras a ese sueo solicita el crdito, para la compra de bebidas, lcteos, carnes, hortalizas y dems artculos de primera necesidad. Para poder abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
The Integracin committee is in its second loan cycle within Fundacin Paraguaya's "Entrepreneurial Women" program. The group has 12 members who are from Asuncin. The women who belong to this committee work hard to provide for their families so that they can enjoy what they themselves lacked during their childhoods. They work to provide their families with the resources they need for their education and training.
Maria is one of the group's members. She tells us that she worked hard to open her grocery store. She started out with a small investment of money but today she has a good, well-stocked business. Her wish is to be able to continue growing her business and thereby continue helping her family. With a view to fulfilling this dream, she is requesting a loan to buy drinks, dairy products, meat, vegetables and other basic household products with which to stock her business.

loan.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, meat, vegetables and other basic household products

loan.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es: El comit Mujeres Luchadoras es de la ciudad de Asuncin, se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundacin Paraguaya, tiene 16 integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan en un ambiente de cooperacin y mutuo respeto. Su deseo es poder salir adelante, para que de esa forma puedan ayudar a sus familias. Mercedes es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de cosmticos de todo tipo de marcas que trae de todos lados. Comenz solo con unas cuantas clientas, pero gracias a su buena onda y a los buenos precios que tiene, hoy en da ya tiene una clientela bien formada, por lo que ya tiene mayores ganancias. Su meta es poder seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo y es por ello que se esfuerza mucho. Solicita el crdito para la compra de cosmticos, y de esa forma poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Luchadoras committee are from the city of Asuncin. The group is in its fourth loan cycle within Fundacin Paraguaya's "Entrepreneurial Women" program. It has 16 members who all work together within an atmosphere of cooperation and mutual respect. Their wish is to get ahead in life so that they can help their families.
Mercedes is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman and she tells us that she sells different brands of cosmetics which she gets from different places. She started out working alone and had just a few customers. However, thanks to the fact that she sells the latest products and offers good prices, she now has a well-established customer base and so makes more profits.
Mercedes' goal is to continue helping her family through her work and so she works very hard. She is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics so that she can fill her customers' orders.

loan.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To rent a new room for his business.

loan.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo se form con vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Concepcin, quienes vieron una oportunidad de Progreso y ayuda para ellas y su familia por medio del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundacin Paraguaya. El grupo se halla integrado por 18 mujeres muy unidas y trabajadoras. Miryan es una de estas mujeres, que por medio de su arduo trabajo, sacrificio ha podido darle a su familia lo que necesitan para una mejor vida. Ella es una de esas personas que piensa que trabajando y esforzndose el da a da podr salir adelante y superar la pobreza. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo y gracias a esto tiene el dinero necesario para el da a da. Ella pide la ayuda de fundacin paraguaya y de kiva para la compra de prendas, como ser remeras, pantalones, camisas, shorts y dems tipos, con los cuales podr surtirse y dar ms variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group was formed by friends and neighbors from the city of Concepcin. They saw an opportunity for progress and help for themselves and their families through the Program for Enterprising Women with the Fundacin Paraguaya. The group is comprised of 18 very united and hard-working women.
Miryan is one of these women. Through her hard work and sacrifice she has been able to give her family what they need for a better life. She is one of those people who believe that by working hard and putting forth great effort day after day you can get ahead and overcome poverty. She says that she sells all types of clothes. Thanks to this she has the money that she needs day to day.
She is asking for help from the Fundacin Paraguaya and from Kiva. She will buy clothes like t-shirts, pants, shirts, shorts, and other types of clothing. With these clothes she will be able to stock up and give her customers greater variety.

loan.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loan.name: Wilberforce

texts.en: Wilberforce is a married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 18 years. He describes himself as honest and God-fearing. He operates a carpentry shop where he sells furniture. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a highly populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy timber for making furniture. His business goal is to run more furniture stores within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will run a showroom for furniture.

loan.use: to buy more timber for making furniture.

loan.name: Paschalia

texts.en: Paschalia is a married woman. She has a daughter who is 7 years old. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She operates a grocery stall where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as low purchasing power. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. Paschalia's business goal is to expand the grocery store within 5 years.

loan.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loan.name: Kua Guapa Group

texts.es: El comit se Denomina Kua Guapa en homenaje a las mujeres que buscan su progreso. Ellas agradecen la oportunidad que les brinda la Fundacin Paraguaya, ya que tendrn nuevas oportunidades para emprender un mejor trabajo, colaborando con los ingreso de su hogar y as brindarle a sus hijos una mejor educacin y nivel de vida. Digna muy trabajadora y dice que por medio del trabajo que hace ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo. Digna vende bebidas de todo tipo, como ser gaseosas, aguas, cervezas, freeze y dems. Tiene mucha venta, en especial los fines de semana, que es cuando ms gente tiene. Desea poder ampliar su negocio y de esa forma tener ms espacio para tener ms bebidas. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de cervezas, gaseosas, vinos y otros, con lo cual podr surtir su negocio con ms variedad de productos.
texts.en:
This group is named Kua Guapa in honor of the women who seek progress. They are grateful for the opportunity that the Fundacin Paraguaya is giving them. They will have new opportunities to undertake better work and to collaborate on the household income. This way they will give their children a better education and a better standard of living.
Digna is a very hard-worker. She says that through her work, with great sacrifice and effort, she has been able to get her family ahead. Digna sells all types of drinks like soft drinks, water, beer, wine, and others.
She has a lot of sales, especially on the week-ends, which is when she has the most people. She wishes to be able to expand her business. This way she will have more space in order to have more drinks.
She is requesting the loan to buy beer, soft drinks, wine, and others. With these drinks she will be able to stock her business with a greater variety of products.

loan.use: to buy beer, soft drinks, wine, and other drinks.

loan.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu is married and has a 17-year old child who is in school. She has been working with Maya for 2 years and has 4 years of experience selling organic cleaning agents. Dudus customers include households and businesses.
Dudu struggled initially because her customers were hesitant to buy from a local organic cleaning agent company. However, she gained her customers' trust over time through free trials, and Ersag is now a well-known company in the local organic cleaning agent market. Dudu opened her store with Maya financing and she wants to use the new loan to buy more products in bulk at a discount to increase her profits.
In the future, Dudu wants to become a manager responsible for the Eskisehir territory with the same company. In addition, Dudu wants to support her 4-person family financially. Dudu is very ambitious and inspires confidence.
Translated from Turkish by Maya volunteers
Dudu evli ve 17 yanda okula giden ocuu var. Dudu, Maya ile 2 yldr alyor ve 4 yldr organik temizleme rnleri satyor. Dudunun mterileri ev hanmlar ve i dnyasn ieriyor. Dudu ,balangta organik temizlik rnlerinden almak istemeyen mterilerle ok mcadele etti. Dudu,zamanla mterilerin gvenini kazand ve imdi Ersag denince organik temizleme rnleri olarak biliniyor. Mayadan ald kredi ile ofisini at. nsanlar onu rahat bir ortamda buluyorlar.letiim ve sat ok daha kolay oluyor. Gelecekte, bu firmada Eskiehir mdrl olmay dnyorum. Dudu Hanm,4 kiilik bir aile . Eine maddi konuda destek oluyor,kznn okul masraflarn karlyor. Hrsl ve gven verici.

loan.use: to buy organic cleaning agents in bulk for resale.

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a single woman. She has a son who is 7 years old. She describes herself as a responsible woman. She operates a butcher shop where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a busy market and her primary customers are local residents and newcomers. She describes her biggest business challenge as occasional shortages of meat. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more meat. Margaret's business goal is to own a vehicle to allow her to deliver meat to customers within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more meat.

loan.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 32 years old, married to Johnson, and they have two children. She has been operating a poultry farm for the last six years, earning a monthly income of Kes 15,000.
She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 10,000. She will use the funds to purchase chickens and growers' mash. With the anticipated profits she will cover school fees.
Her hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loan.use: To purchase growers' mash and chickens.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old married and has three children. She has been buying and selling scrap metal for the last 7 years earning a monthly income of Kes 9000.
She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 7,000. She will use the loan to purchase more scrap metals for sale. With the anticipated profits she will pay school fees.
Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and grow her business.

loan.use: to buy scrap metals.

loan.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is a single woman. She has a daughter who is five years old. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located at a busy and populated area and her primary customers are residents in her home area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delay of payments from customers. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more oil. Dorothy's business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loan.use: To buy more cosmetics such as body oil etc.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase stock of tea leaves, sugar, bread, and maize flour.

loan.name: Tesai Group

texts.es: El comit se Denomina TESAI en homenaje a la pequea fundacin de salud de su Barrio. Las integrantes agradecen la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundacin Paraguaya, pues por medio del programa que esta les brinda tienen la posibilidad de ayudar a sus familias y de aumentar sus ingresos. Actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo con 15 integrantes. Una de los miembros es la seora Antonia, quien se encarga de la venta de productos de limpieza que ella misma elabora de forma artesanal. Comenta que le va muy bien, ya que a las personas les gusta mucho los productos que ella hace, por que son de buena calidad y econmicos. Ella se define como una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Quienes la inspiran a seguir creciendo y superarse son sus familiares, pues ellos siempre la apoyan. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de los qumicos que necesita para elaborar los productos de limpieza que vende, como ser, cloro, esencias, fragancias, lavandinas y dems. Agradece a la fundacin y kiva por la oportunidad que progreso que les da a ella y a sus compaeras.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named Tesai in honor of the small health foundation in the neighborhood. The members are grateful for the opportunity the Fundacin Paraguaya is giving them. It is through this program that they have the possibility of helping their families and of increasing their income. They are currently in their fourth cycle with 15 members.
Antonia is one of the members. She sells cleaning products that she makes herself. She says that it is going very well for her. People really like the products that she makes because they are of good quality and economical. She is described as an enterprising and very hard-working woman. Her family always supports her and inspires her to continue growing and improving.
She is requesting the loan to buy the chemicals that she needs to make the cleaning products that she sells. She will buy things like chlorine, essences, fragrances, bleach, and others. She is grateful to the Fundacin and Kiva for the opportunity to progress that they are giving her and her colleagues.

loan.use: to buy chlorine, essences, fragrances, bleach, and others to make cleaning products.

loan.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She has operated a food store for 7 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are workers within the business area. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of ingredients. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to run a restaurant within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy ingredients for preparing food to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed.

loan.name: Nduku

texts.en:
Nduku is 42 years old. She is married to Muinde and they have two children. She has run a dairy farming business for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 6500.
She is requesting for her first loan with KADET Ltd in the amount of KES 5000. She will use the loan to purchase feeds for her dairy cows. With the anticipated profits she will save to increase her stocks of dairy feed.
Her hopes and dreams are to become a large-scale dairy farmer and to become financially stable.

loan.use: To buy feed for her cows.

loan.name: Le Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es: El comit se Denomina La Esperanza 2 en homenaje a la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundacin Paraguaya; ya que las mismas seoras tendrn nuevas oportunidades para emprender un mejor trabajo, colaborando con los ingreso de su hogar y as brindarle a sus hijos un mejor bienestar. El grupo est en el quinto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundacin Paraguaya. Nilda vende ropas desde hace ya un tiempo, cuenta que tiene muy buena venta ya que siempre tiene buena variedad de prendas y es ello lo que atrae a los clientes. Gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y tambin ayudar a su familia con los gastos diarios. Su meta es tener una gran tienda de ropas donde poder ofrecer ms. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de prendas de verano, pues estamos en el verano y necesita abastecerse con mejores productos.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called La Esperanza 2" (Hope 2) in tribute to the opportunities that are provided by the Fundacin Paraguaya, since these women will have new opportunities to start up a better business, contribute more income to their households, and in this way provide for the well-being of their children. This group is in its 5th loan cycle in the Enterprising Women program of the Fundacin Paraguaya.
Nilda has been selling clothing for a while. She tells us that she has very good sales, because she always has a good variety of garments, and this is what allows her to attract customers. Thanks to her work, she has been able to get ahead and also help her family with the household expenses. Her goal is to have a big clothing store where she could offer more clothing for sale.
She is requesting a loan to buy summer clothing, as it is now summer and she needs to stock up with better products.

loan.use: to buy summer clothing to sell

loan.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 43 years old and married with two children. She has been farming for the last 6 years, earning a monthly income of KES 6000.
She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd in the amount of KES 5000. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides. With the anticipated profits, she will buy food for her children.
Her hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loan.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman. She has 2 children aged 5 months and 5 years. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She operates an open-air retail business where she sells clothing materials. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as delayed payments from her customers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothing materials. Her business goal is to expand her open-air clothing materials business within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy clothing materials.

loan.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 35 years old. She is married with five children. Two of them are enrolled in school.
Mediatrice sells foodstuffs which she has been doing for four years. She has requested the loan to buy more foodstuffs such as maize, sorghum and beans to sell. With the profits, she will pay school fees for the children. In the future, she would like to have a big stock.

loan.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loan.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es: El comit se Denomina Mujeres Luchadoras estn en el Quinto Ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundacin paraguaya, con 19 integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsables entre ellas, tienen un gran espritu emprendedor para realizar actividades que les ayudan a fomentar su compaerismo. Rosa es una de estas mujeres trabajadoras y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de Carbn. Dice que de un tiempo para ac el carbn tiene mucha salida, ya que hoy en da el gas es muy caro, por es monto este negocio y gracias a este ha podido ganarse el sustento diario. Su propsito es seguir ayudando a su familia, y hacer, por medio de su trabajo, que tengan una vida digna y decorosa. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de carbn, y de esa forma tener en stock, para cuando su cliente se lo soliciten. Agradece a la fundacin y a kiva, por la ayuda que les da.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called Mujeres Luchadoras. The 19 members are in the fifth cycle of Fundacin Paraguaya's program for women entrepreneurs. It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very unified, supportive, and responsible. They have a great entrepreneurial spirit to carry out work that helps them promote companionship among themselves.
Rosa is one of these hardworking women, and she tells us that she works selling charcoal. She says that charcoal has been selling for some time because today gas is very expensive. This is why she set up this business, and thanks to this she has been able to earn herself a daily living. Her goal is to continue helping her family and, through her job, give them a dignified and decent life.
She is requesting the loan to buy charcoal to have in stock for when her customers ask her for it. She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the help they are giving her.

loan.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loan.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 30 years old. She has spent four years selling foodstuffs. She has two children seven months and three years old. Angelique has requested the loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.
The profits from the business will be used for savings. She would like to have a big stock in the future.

loan.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell such as beans and sorghum.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more chickens and poultry feed.

loan.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: La seora Rosario es cliente de la institucin desde el 2011 ella trabajaba antes en la agencia Pampahasi es una cliente puntual ella vive en zona de Pampahasi en alquiler ella vive con su hijo el cual le ayuda con los gastos de la casa la Sra. Rosario se dedica a la confeccin de ropa hace ya varios aos, confecciona ropa de dormir para nios y poleras, pijamas los cuales los realiza a pedido y tambin entrega en los distintos mercados de la ciudad, el dinero del crdito ser para la compra de telas e hilos y material que necesita para la confeccin de ropa ya que tiene pedidos para fin de ao que entregar, la Sr. Rosario es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, se siente feliz con el apoyo brindado por la institucin.
texts.en: Rosario has been a client of EMPRENDER since 2011; she worked before with the Pampahasi office. She is a punctual client who lives in the Pampahasi area. She lives in a rented home with her son, who helps her with the household expenses. Rosario has had a business making clothing for a number of years. She makes sleepwear for children, T-shirts, and pajamas to order, and she also delivers her products to various markets in the city. The money from this loan will be used to buy fabric, thread and supplies that she needs to make the clothing, since she has orders from the end of the year that she needs to fulfill. Rosario is a very friendly and hardworking person. She feels happy with the support provided by this institution.

loan.use: to buy fabric and thread

loan.name: Eluminee

texts.en:
Eluminee is 30 years old. She has four children aged between 3 and 10 years. Two of them go to school. She is married to a farmer. She has a small shop which she has been running for four years.
With the loan she will buy more products such as sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees. She wants to have a big shop in the future.

loan.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell.

loan.name: Mujeres Sobresalientes De San Jos Group

texts.es: 13 mujeres de Ciudad del Este se han unido con el propsito de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familias, que se esfuerzan da a da por poder darle el sustento a sus hijos y familiares. Son mu trabajadoras, emprendedoras y por sobre todo muy luchadoras. Ven en el programa de la fundacin paraguaya una gran oportunidad de progreso. Una de estas laboriosas mujeres es Fulbia, quien trabaja en la costura, desde hace ya un buen tiempo. Ella ha trabajado en esto por un buen tiempo, por lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le acerca muchos trabajos. Deseo poder seguir ampliando su negocio y es por ello que siempre se esfuerza al mximo, para poder lograr sus objetivos. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de cierres, botones, telas, gomas y dems insumos necesarios par poder abastecerse y tener materiales para poder cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes.
texts.en:
Thirteen women from Ciudad del Este have come together with the goal of working together to be able to help each other through that work. The women are heads of household who make the effort every day to be able to support their children and families. They are very hardworking and entrepreneurial, and above all they all are fighters. They see the Fundacin Paraguaya program as a great opportunity for progress.
One of these hardworking women is Fulbia, who has worked in sewing for a long time. She has a good clientele that brings her a lot of work because she has worked in this for a long time. She wants to be able to continue expanding her business, so she always makes the maximum effort to be able to achieve her goals.
She is requesting the loan to buy clasps, buttons, fabric, glue, and other supplies necessary to be able to stock up and have materials to be able to satisfy the customers' requests.

loan.use: to buy clasps, buttons, fabric, glue, and other supplies.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy stocks of sugar, bread, tea leaves, and flour.

loan.name: Clemence

texts.en: Clemence is 31 years old. She has 3 children who are between 6 and 10 years old. Clemence has been running a shop for 2 years. With the requested loan, she will buy more items such as rice, sugar, and home products to sell. She plans to use the profits to renovate her house. She would like to own a shop in the future.

loan.use: To buy more rice and sugar to sell.

loan.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a single woman. She describes herself as committed to her work. She operates an open-air retail shop where she sells tomatoes and onions. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of transporting tomatoes and onions. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more tomatoes to sell. Her business goal is to own a permanent location for her business within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell.

loan.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 44 years old and married to Kawinzi. She has 4 children. She has been operating a retail food stall for the past year, earning a monthly income of KES 11,700.
She is requesting her first loan, in the amount of KES 20,000. She will use the funds to purchase stocks of maize, flour, sugar, rice, and cooking fat. With the anticipated profits she will educate her children.
Her hopes and dreams are to have the shop fully stocked and to have a stable family.

loan.use: to purchase stocks of maize, flour, sugar, rice, and cooking fat to sell.

loan.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes has five children between the ages of 6 and 21 years, and all of them attend school. Agnes sells foodstuffs such as beans, sorghum, and maize. She has requested a loan to purchase more beans and sorghum to sell. She wants to save the profits she will make from the business. She would like to own a big stock in the future.

loan.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loan.name: Asunta

texts.es: La seora Asunta es cliente nueva de la institucin ella es la mama de uno de nuestros clientes mas antiguos de la institucin, la seora Asunta vive en la ciudad de El Alto la seora asunta se dedica a la venta de coca (La hoja de coca (Erythroxylum Coca) es utilizada como planta medicinal desde hace siglos, especialmente en las culturas andinas), La Sra. Asunta Trae la coca por Takes(quintales) los cuales los trae de los yungas dos veces por semana los cuales los comercializa en el mercado de la coca el crdito que esta solicitando es para la compra de coca por mayor a persona que tiene licencia para la venta de coca, la Sra. Asunta es una persona muy trabajadora, se esfuerza mucho ya que el viaje a la localidad de los yungas es largo y por la carretera muy peligrosa por ser una camino muy accidentado, pero ella siempre fuerte, para salir adelante.
texts.en: Asunta is a new client of EMPRENDER. She is the mother of one of EMPRENDER's most longstanding clients. Asunta lives in the city of El Alto. She has a business selling coca leaves. Coca (Erythroxylum Coca) has been used as a medicinal plant for centuries, especially in the Andean culture. Asunta brings the coca leaves by the quintal (46 kilograms). She brings them through the Yungas, (subtropical valleys located in the foothills of the Andes), 2 days a week and sells them in the coca market. The loan she is requesting is to purchase coca at wholesale from a person who has a license to sell coca. Asunta is a very hardworking person who exerts herself a lot, since the trip from the Yungas is long and the road is very treacherous as it is known to have many fatal accidents. But she stays strong so that she can get ahead.

loan.use: to buy 46 kg sacks of coca leaves

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more clothing materials.

loan.name: Ykua Ver Group

texts.es: El comit se denomina Ykua Vera, en alusin al barrio donde viven todas las miembros, ellas estn en el Dcimo Ciclo con 12 integrantes. Es un grupo muy unido, solidario y responsable. Las integrantes poseen un gran espritu emprendedor, ya que estn al da con las cuotas, realizan actividades de recaudacin de fondos para ayudarse en caso de inconvenientes. Una de las miembros es la seora Rosalina, quien nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de bocaditos y bebidas. Cuenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, pues siempre recibe pedido de bocaditos para acontecimientos y eventos y eso hace correr la voz y as aumenta la cantidad de clientela que tiene. Su meta es tener un negocio donde vender sus bocaditos y bebidas y de esa forma ofrecerles ms comodidad a sus clientes. Ella solicita el crdito para la compra de carnes, condimentos, verduras, panificados y dems insumos para la elaboracin de los bocaditos que vende. Agradece a la fundacin y a kiva por la oportunidad de progreso que estas le dan.
texts.en:
The communal bank is named Ykua Vera, an allusion to the neighborhood where all the members live. They are in the tenth cycle with 12 members. It is a very unified, supportive, and responsible group. The members have a great entrepreneurial spirit because they are current with their payments. They have fund-raising activities to help each other in case of problems.
One of the members is Rosalina, who tells us that she works selling snacks and beverages. She says that it is going very well for her in her business because she always gets requests for snacks for occasions and events. This spreads the word and so her clientele expands. Her goal is to have a business where she can sell her snacks and beverages, and in this way offer her customers greater comfort.
She is requesting the loan to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, bread, and other supplies to make the snacks she sells. She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity for the progress that they are giving her.

loan.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, bread, and other supplies.

loan.name: Searle

texts.es: Searle est recibiendo su segundo credikiva, para comprar materiales mejorar su vivienda. Ella se siente muy competente para pagar su crdito oportunamente, debido a que con su anterior credikiva, le fue muy bien lo invirti en insumos de confeccin y respondi oportunamente a sus clientes. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es Muchas gracias por el crdito a bajos intereses. porque le permiti una mejor inversin y la posibilidad de ser oportuna.
texts.en:
Searle is receiving her second Kiva loan, to buy materials to improve her house. She feels very capable of repaying the loan in time because with her previous Kiva loan it went well for her. She invested it in tailoring supplies and responded to her customers in a timely fashion.
Her message to Kiva lenders is "Thank you very much for the low-interest loan," because it allowed her a better investment and the possibility of being timely.

loan.use: to buy materials to improve her house.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase palm fruit for the production of her oil for sale.

loan.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is 39 years old. She is married to a business man. She has six children between 6 and 19 years old, and all of them are enrolled in school.
She has been running a boutique for the past three years. She wants the loan to buy more items such as sugar, rice, soaps and salt to sell.
With the profits, she plans to pay school fees for her children. She dreams of owning a big boutique in the future.

loan.use: To buy more sugar, rice and soaps to sell.

loan.name: Nzonge

texts.en:
Nzonge is 65 years old, married and has three children. He has been running a retail shop for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd. of KES 15,000. He will use the loan to purchase stock of maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and tea leaves. With the anticipated profits he will save for his old age.
His hopes to have a stable business and a stable family.

loan.use: To purchase stock of maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and tea leaves.

loan.name: Janviere

texts.en:
Janviere is 47 years old. Her husband is a pastor. They have seven children between the ages of 23 and 8, and all go to school.
For the past three years, Janviere has sold food such as bananas. She has requested the loan to buy more bananas to sell. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.
In the future, she would like to add new items such as soft drinks in her business.

loan.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loan.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena forma parte del Banco comunal El Almendral perteneciente a la comuna de Pealoln, ciudad de Santiago. Ella se dedica al rubro de la peluquera, desde hace tres aos. Realiz algunos cursos de especializacin, lo que le permiti perfeccionarse y emprender en su negocio. Especficamente en corte de pelo, peinados y tinturas. Elena se desempea en sus labores de peluquera de lunes a viernes y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ya que sus hijos son pequeos y ella es quien se dirige a los domicilios particulares de sus clientes. Su mercadera la compra en una distribuidora que se especializa en vender productos para el cabello. Una de las metas de Elena en su negocio, son tener la oportunidad de abrir un local como saln de belleza, en el cual pueda atender a sus clientes. Con el crdito comprar un secador de pelo, una mquina rasuradora y tijeras. Elena vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 17, 9 y 8 aos de edad, sus sueos a nivel personales son brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella est muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Adems se siente muy cmoda con la compaa de las dems emprendedoras del grupo del Banco comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual tambin le ha servido como una momento de distraccin. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera. Pealoln se localiza al oriente de la regin metropolitana. Cuenta con diversos atractivos tales como vias, edificios considerados patrimonio histrico y sitios naturales de excursin, elementos que estn transformando a esta comuna en un nuevo panorama turstico dentro de la regin Metropolitana.
texts.en:
Elena is part of the El Almedral communal bank located in the town of Pealoln, city of Santiago. She has worked in the area of hairdressing for three years. She took some specialized courses, which allowed her to improve herself and launch her business, specifically in haircuts, hairstyles, and dyes.
Elena performs her hairdressing duties from Monday through Friday, and she arranges her schedule according to her availability, since her children are young and it is she who goes to the homes of her different customers. She buys her merchandise from a distributor that specializes in selling hair products. One of Elena's business goals is to have the opportunity to open a store as a beauty salon where she can see her customers.
With the loan she will buy a hair dryer, an electric razor, and scissors.
Elena lives with her husband and three children, ages 17, 9, and 8. Her personal dream is to give her family a better quality of life.
She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her because it has allowed her to invest in her business. She also feels very comfortable with the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank group because they share different activities and interests, which also has served to distract her for a moment. With regard to the training given in the meetings, she has learned to run her business better.
Pealoln is located in the east of the metropolitan area. It has various attractions such as vineyards, buildings considered part of the cultural heritage, and excursions to natural areas, elements that are changing this town into a new tourism scene within the metropolitan region.

loan.use: to buy a hair dryer, an electric razor, and scissors.

loan.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is age 28 years. She is married and has three children between 10 months and 4 years old. None of her children attends school.
Olive owns a boutique that she has been running for the past three years.
With the loan she will buy more items such as sugar, salt and cooking oil. She expects to use the profits for savings.
In the future, Olive dreams of owning a booming shop.

loan.use: To buy more sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loan.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 28-year-old married woman. She has two children age 7 years and 11 years. She describes herself as loving and friendly.
She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located along a busy street and her customers are both repeat and new.
She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes.
Her business goal is to run another clothes retail store within five years.

loan.use: To buy more clothes.

loan.name: Crispus Hamisi

texts.en:
Crispus Hamisi is a 39-year-old livestock seller in Mariakani. He is the married father of three. He has been selling livestock for the past two years successfully.
This is Crispus third loan from KADET. He plans to buy more cows, goats and sheep to resell to his customers.
He will use the proceeds to educate his children and repay his loan. He hopes to have a successful business.

loan.use: to buy more cows, goats and sheep

loan.name: Ada Zila

texts.es: Ada Zila es una emprendedora que lucha por salir adelante da a da junto con sus hijos, esta emprendedora ya ha tenido crdito con Fundacin Len 2000 en el cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseo de superacin en el negocio y en lo personal. Su mayor sueo es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios que es la mejor herencia que le dejara. Actualmente Ada Zila est solicitando crdito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de pantalones para damas, caballeros, nios, blusa, cosmticos entre otros productos que demandan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ada Zila is an entrepreneur who fights to get ahead every day with her children. This entrepreneur has had a loan already with Fundacin Len 2000, in which she has shown herself to be a responsible person with a desire to improve herself in business and personally. Her biggest dream is that her children will finish their studies, which is the best legacy she will leave them.
Currently Ada Zila is requesting a loan to invest in her business by buying pants for women, men, and children; blouses; cosmetics; and other products that her customers request.

loan.use: to buy pants for women, men, and children; blouses; cosmetics; and other products.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy more palm kernel to produce more palm oil for sale.

loan.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has four children. Ekua sells kenkey (a dumpling-like food) and fried fish at Ankako. She has done this for six years. Her husband is a farmer.
Ekua will use the loan to buy more maize for the preparation of her kenkey and more fish for sale.
With the new profits, Ekua hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy more maize for the preparation of her kenkey and to buy more fish for sale.

loan.name: Alfonce

texts.en:
Alfonce is 60 years old and married, with seven children whose ages range from 15 years to 30 years old. He describes himself as focused.
Alfonce operates a retail open air business where he sells posts. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in his village area and his primary customers are repeat and new. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power from customers. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more posts. His business goal is to expand his post selling business within five years.

loan.use: To buy more posts for resale.

loan.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba operates a grocery shop in Ankako. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer.
Araba has been selling groceries for five years. She uses her income to assist her husband with paying their utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase more groceries for resale at her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create awareness of, and to expand, her business.

loan.use: to purchase more groceries for resale at her shop.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy more fried fish for resale.

loan.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena de 33 aos de edad trabaja como docente de secundaria desde hace 12 aos,cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos, pues trabaja fuera de la ciudad y le enva dinero para los gastos del hogar, pues ambos desean para sus hijos una vida mejor. Este credito lo requiere para compra de pintura y pintar la vivienda para que se mire bonita y tenga mayor durabilidad. Su mayor sueo en la vida es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su hogar que sus hijos gozen de salud y estudien para que sean personas de bien en la sociedad. segun referencias comerciales y personales es una joven muy responsable con muchos deseos de superacin profesional y laboral,
texts.en:
Martha Lorena, who is 33 years old, has worked as a middle school teacher for 12 years. She has the help of the father of her children, who works outside the city and sends her money for household expenses. Both hope for a better life for their children.
She needs this loan to buy paint and to paint the house so that it looks nice and is more durable. Her greatest dream in life is to improve her living conditions and the conditions of her house, and that her children enjoy good health and study so they can be upstanding people of society. With commercial and personal references, she is a responsible young woman with the desire to get ahead professionally and in her work.

loan.use: to paint her house.

loan.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Memuna sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together) and she serves it with meat and fish stew in Ankako. She is married and has seven dependents. Her husband works at a gas filling station.
Memuna has been selling waakye for 30 years. She uses her income to assist her husband with pay their housing bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice, beans, fish, meat and other ingredients for the preparation of the waakye to be sold. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to set up a good and convenient place to sell.

loan.use: to buy bags of rice, beans, fish, meat and other ingredients for the preparation of waakye to be sold.

loan.name: Nuris Esther
