Jovy has a karaoke shop that provides karaoke services where the customers pay five pesos per song. She also sells soft-drinks and other beverages in her karaoke shop. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for the electricity and buy beverages to sell.
Jovy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jovy hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to pay for the electricity and buy beverages to sell.

loan.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children.
Segundina has a food shop or "carenderia" that sells viands like chicken & pork "adobo", beef stew & fried fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell.
Segundina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Segundina hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell.

loan.name: Intisar

texts.en:
Intisar, 38 years old, is a married woman with no children. She is an employee at one of the governmental entities.
Beside her job, Intisar opened a small shop selling stationery items and cosmetics products. She has applied for a loan to increase the quantity of cosmetics at her shop and enhance the internal decoration.

loan.use: to increase the quantity of cosmetics at her shop and enhance the internal decoration.

loan.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Roberta has a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Roberta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Roberta hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
Epifaniahas a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Epifania has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Epifania hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Rushdi

texts.en:
Rushdi is a 36-year-old married man who has a tailoring shop.
It has been almost 18 years now since he has had the shop, and it is running successfully. Mainly he tailors different models of suits. Now he has applied for a loan in order to buy more sewing machines and expand the shop space.

loan.use: to buy more sewing machines and expand the shop space.

loan.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children.
Eulalia has a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Eulalia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eulalia hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa, 36 years old, is a wife and mother of two. She works as a teacher and her husband used to work as a pharmacist, but now he is retired.
Using her husbands experience, they started a small business manufacturing cosmetics and filling them into small containers for sale.
Now Sanaa has applied for a loan to buy basic materials for making cosmetic products to increase their productivity.

loan.use: to buy basic materials for making cosmetic products.

loan.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
Nena has a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Nena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nena hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is 55 years old and a hard-working mother of five. She works as a teacher, and because of that she insists on getting her sons and daughters a good education and turning them into productive members of society.
Her youngest son Abdallah is now a college student who wants to get his Bachelor degree in computer information system and then continue to get a Master's degree, too.
To help her son finish his education at the first level, Amal has applied for a loan to pay for his semester fees. Because Amal is a conservative person, she asked her son Abdallah to appear in the photo instead of her.

loan.use: to pay for her son's semester fees.

loan.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with two children.
Ailyn has a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Ailyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ailyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
Leonora has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years.
She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Leonora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
Luzviminda has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years.
She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Luzviminda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Luzviminda hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Lilian Kamuche

texts.en:
Lilian Kamuche is a 35-year-old tailor in Mariakani. She is the single mother of two children. She has been sewing clothes for her customers for the past five years. She is doing great.
This is Lilians second loan from KADET. She plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads and cloth materials. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan.
She hopes to have a successful business.

loan.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads and cloth materials.

loan.name: Mary Boke

texts.en:
Mary Boke is a 39-year-old fruits and vegetables seller in Mombasa. She is married. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for the past four years with great success.
This is Marys first loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more bananas, oranges, pineapples, mangoes, kale and tomatoes.
She will use the anticipated profits to open another business and to repay her loan. She hopes to purchase a piece of land and build her own permanent house.

loan.use: to purchase more bananas, oranges, pineapples, mangoes, kale and tomatoes.

loan.name: Jackton Wanga

texts.en:
Jackton Wanga is a 26-year-old tailor in Mombasa. He is a married father of one child. He has been doing tailoring for the past four years and he is doing great.
This is Jacktons first loan from KADET. He plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread and cloth materials.
He will use the anticipated profits to add more materials and repay his loan.
He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loan.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread and cloth materials.

loan.name: Nelly Amina

texts.en:
Nelly Amina is a 30-year-old business lady who sells fruits and vegetables in Mombasa. She is married and has been doing this business for the last one year with great success.
This is Nellys first loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more coconuts, mangoes, kale and tomatoes to resell to her customers.
She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan.
She hopes to have an expanded, well known business.

loan.use: to purchase more coconuts, mangoes, kale and tomatoes.

loan.name: Victoria Bahati

texts.en:
Victoria Bahati is a 35-year-old fruits and vegetables seller in Mombasa. She is the married mother of four. She has been selling fruits and vegetables to her customers for the past ten years with great success.
This is Victorias first loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more mangoes, bananas, pineapples, kale, cabbages and oranges.
She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan.
She hopes to excel in the business.

loan.use: to purchase more mangoes, bananas, pineapples, kale, cabbages and oranges.

loan.name: Jukunay

texts.en: Jukunay is 56 years old, a widow and raised seven children. She started her business in animal husbandry 20 years ago with an initial sum of 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistent work, Jukunay's business yields about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products. She also works on 3.12 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes and barley. In the summer, Jukunay and her family travel to the pastures ("jailoo") of the mountain lake Son-Kol, where they set up a "yurt" - national felt house - where tourists and visiting guests can stop. In order to further develop her animal husbandry business, Jukunay requested a loan in the sum of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase three bulls and ten sheep. She plans to invest the profits into further increasing livestock headcount.

loan.use: to purchase livestock

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more oranges, avocados, kale, tomatoes, pineapples, plums, bananas and mangoes.

loan.name: Josphat Mavu

texts.en:
Josphat Mavu is a 31-year-old tailor in Voi. He is married and has been sewing clothes for his customers for the last six years with great success.
This is Josphats first loan from KADET. He plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads and cloth materials.
He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land to build business premises.
He hopes to have a prosperous life.

loan.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads and cloth materials.

loan.name: Selinah Omenya

texts.en:
Selinah Omenya is a 45-year-old private school proprietor in Shanzu, Mombasa. She is married and she has been running this business for the past 13 years and she is doing great.
This is Selinahs third loan from KADET. She plans to construct more classes and buy new desks.
She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and improve her school. She hopes to have the most well known school in the coast province.

loan.use: to construct more classes and buy new desks.

loan.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 45-year-old man. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a father of three children. He completed secondary school only.
Mohammed`s business is a grocery store that he started five years ago with limited capital. It is the main source of income for feeding his family. Though he has been working hard, he can`t meet his customers' requirements due to limited capital as wholesalers require cash payment to provide him grocery supplies. So, Mohammed started to offer more services to customers such as bringing foods and soft drinks to their homes, etc which helped him to attract more clients.
Mohammed was happy about the attracting new clients but on the other hand, the financial challenge of meeting customers' demand is hindering his business progress and growth. So, he took a loan of 100,000 YER in order to purchase grocery supplies that his shop needs.
In the future, Mohammed hopes to expand his business into a supermarket.

loan.use: to purchase grocery supplies for his business.

loan.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La seora Mara es casada con el seor Agustn, tiene 2 hijos uno de 6 aos y otro de 10 aos que se encuentran en edad escolar, la seora vive en alquiler mas de 5 aos en el mismo lugar. La seora Mara se dedica a la venta de comida ambulando por lugares concurridos, ella vende todos los das de la semana tomndose as un da de descanso para estar con su familia. El prstamo es para invertir en otro negocio, comercio de arroz y venta de arroz, debidos a que ella asegura que puede tener un mejor ingreso ya que esto llevara a distintas provincias, siempre alternando con su primera actividad que es la venta de comida, la Sra. Mara es una persona muy amable y trabajadora se siente muy feliz por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mara is married to Agustn and they have two children, ages six and ten, who are in school. For over five years they have lived in the same rental property. Mara is a street vendor and sells food in busy areas. She works six days a week and takes a day off to be with family. The loan she is requesting is to invest in another business, rice trade and sales. She claims she can earn a better income this way since it will mean traveling to other provinces, although she will alternate this activity with her main food business. Mara is a very kind, hard-working person who is content with the support she has received.

loan.use: To buy bulk rice.

loan.name: Lucila

texts.es: La Seora Lucila se dedica a la venta de comida en la zona de El Tejar, en la casa de sus suegros, ella vive en la ciudad de El Alto donde diariamente baja a la ciudad a vender su comida para generar ingresos para la construccin de su domicilio, su sueo es ver terminada su casa tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 an viven con ella y su esposo quien es empleado en un Supermercado de la Ciudad de La Paz, ella es muy trabajadora y esta muy contenta por acceder al prstamo ya que ayudara a mejorar su patio para estas pocas de lluvia. En la zona donde ella vende su comida es muy conocida ya que tiene muy buen sazn sus platillos, y por tal motivo tiene mucha clientela.
texts.en:
Lucila sells food in the El Tejar area, in her in-laws house. She lives in the city of El Alto and every day she goes down to the city to sell her food in order to earn income for the construction of her home. Her dream is to see her house finished.
She has five children, and two still live with her and her husband, who is employed in a city supermarket in La Paz. She is very hardworking and is very content to be given a loan that will help her improve her courtyard for the rainy season.
In the area where she sells her food she is well known as she has very tasty food and this is why she has lots of clients.

loan.use: to invest in the courtyard repairs of her home

loan.name: Egnonnam Group

texts.fr: Le groupement EGNONNAM est form de douze personnes qui habitent toutes dans le mme quartier au Bnin et appartiennent un mme groupe de tontine. La reprsentante de ce groupe, nomme Claudine est celle dont la main est leve sur la photo. Claudine est ge de 50 ans, et est marie un certain Martin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolariss et leur charge. Claudine a arrt l'cole au niveau primaire. Depuis cinq ans, Claudine vend des charbons de bois et de lhuile vgtale son domicile ; ce qui permet dassurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Claudine achte ses produits au Bnin. C'est la deuxime fois que Claudine et les autres membres du groupement EGNONNAM sollicitent un crdit auprs de ALID. Ce crdit leur permettra de renforcer leur activit et d'accrotre leur fonds de roulement, afin de mieux rpondre la demande de leur clientle. Le premier prt a t bien rembours.
texts.en: The Egnonnam group is composed of twelve individuals all living in the same area in Benin and belonging to the same "tontine" (a group savings fund). The groups representative, by the name of Claudine, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Claudine is 50 years old and married to a certain Martin. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. Claudine stopped her schooling at the primary level. For the last five years, Claudine has been selling charcoal and vegetable oil out of her home, which allows her together with her husband to provide for different family needs. Claudine stocks up in Benin. This is the second time that Claudine and other members of the Egnonnam group are seeking a loan from ALID. This loan will allow them to bolster their business and increase their working capital in order to meet customer demand better. The first loan has been duly reimbursed.

loan.use: to buy bags of charcoal and jugs of vegetable oil

loan.name: Videkon Group

texts.fr: VIDEKON est un groupement compos de treize personnes qui vivent toutes dans le mme quartier au Bnin. Cest la quatrime fois que ce groupement sollicite un crdit auprs de ALID, afin dlever le niveau de leur activit et de mieux rpondre aux exigences de leur clientle. La reprsentante du groupement du nom de Marie est celle qui a la main leve sur la photo. Marie est ge de 47 ans et vit dans une ville du Bnin. Marie est une veuve ayant trois enfants, tous scolariss, dont deux ne sont plus sa charge. Marie vit avec lenfant qui lui reste charge et assure seule ses diffrentes charges. Marie na pas frquent lcole. Depuis une dizaine danne, Marie vend des ignames et de lharicot son domicile. Cette activit lui gnre des revenus l'aidant ainsi subvenir ses besoins et ceux de lenfant charge. Marie sapprovisionne dans un march du Bnin. Ce crdit permettra certainement Marie et aux autres membres du groupement VIDEKON, de rehausser leur activit et d'accrotre leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu. Les trois premiers prts ont t bien rembourss.
texts.en:
VIDEKON is a group of thirteen people who all live in the same district in Benin. The group is seeking financial assistance from ALID for the fourth time to bolster their activity and better meet customer demand. All three previous loans were correctly repaid.
The groups representative is Mary, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Mary is 47 years old and lives in a city of Benin. She is a widow with three children, all in school, and two of them no longer in her care. She lives with her dependent child and handles the various household responsibilities on her own. She did not attend school.
For the past ten years or so, Mary has been selling yams and beans from her home. The income earned through this activity allows her to support herself and her child. She buys her stock at a market in Benin.
This loan will help Mary and the other members of the group VIDEKON to boost their activity, and increase their sales and revenue.

loan.use: to buy yams and beans for resale.

loan.name: Raison Group

texts.fr: RAISON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres rsident dans le mme quartier. La reprsentante du groupe, Perptue Judith Adjoua Cica (dont la main est leve sur la photo), est ge de 23 ans. Perptue Judith Adjoua Cica est marie un certain Pascal. Le couple a un enfant scolaris et leur charge. Perptue Judith Adjoua Cica vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Perptue Judith Adjoua Cica a arrt lcole au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face ses diffrentes charges, Perptue Judith Adjoua Cica vend depuis quatre ans, divers produits cosmtiques par le systme de distribution. Perptue Judith Adjoua Cica sapprovisionne dans un march du Bnin. Dans la qute de la satisfaction de sa clientle et en vue dlargir son activit, Perptue Judith Adjoua Cica sollicite un troisime crdit auprs de ALID, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe RAISON. Ce crdit leur servira mieux rpondre aux demandes de leur clientle et se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers prts ont t bien rembourss.
texts.en: The RAISON group is made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood. The facilitator of the group, named Perptue Judith Adjoua Cica (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 23 years old. Perptue Judith Adjoua Cica is married to a man named Pascal. They have one child, who goes to school, and whom they financially support. Perptue Judith Adjoua Cica lives with her husband and child. Husband and wife take care of the various household expenses together. Perptue Judith Adjoua Cica left school at the secondary level. In order to support herself, Perptue Judith Adjoua Cica has been selling various cosmetic products through the distribution network for four years. She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and to expand her business, Perptue Judith Adjoua Cica (along with the other two members of the RAISON group) is requesting a third loan from ALID. This loan will allow them to better meet the needs of their customers and to generate more profits. The two previous loans were well repaid.

loan.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics.

loan.name: Akouavi Solange

texts.fr: Akouavi Solange est ge de 40 ans et vit au Bnin. Akouavi Solange n'a pas frquent l'cole. Akouavi Solange est marie un chauffeur du nom de Clment. Le couple a deux enfants scolariss et leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Akouavi Solange vend depuis cinq ans, divers produits vivriers (soja, mas) par le systme de distribution. Akouavi Solange s'approvisionne dans une rgion du Bnin. Grce au revenu que lui gnre cette activit, Akouavi Solange contribue aux diffrentes dpenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientle de plus en plus grandissante, Akouavi Solange sollicite un troisime crdit auprs de ALID. Les deux premiers prts reus par Akouavi Solange ont t bien rembourss.
texts.en: Akouavi Solange is 40 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. Akouavi Solange is married to a driver named Clment. The couple have two children, both of whom are in school and live in the care of their parents. The couple provide for the household together. To meet her needs and those of her children, Akouavi Solange has sold various basic food staples (soybean, maize) through the distribution system for five years. She gets her supplies in a region in Benin. Thanks to the income her activity generates, Akouavi Solange contributes to various family expenses. To satisfy her growing clientele, she is seeking a third loan with ALID. The two previous loans she received were both repaid properly.

loan.use: To buy bags of soybeans and maize.

loan.name: Volonte De Dieu Group

Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges, Florentine Ba vend depuis cinq ans, des friperies de faon ambulante. Florentine Ba sapprovisionne dans un march du Bnin. texts.en: The "Gbenagnon 1" group comprises three people who live in the same area. This is the third time this group is seeking financial support from ALID, in order to raise the level of its business. The group representative, named Florentine Ba, is the woman whose hand is raised in the photo. Florentine Ba is 36 years old and lives in Benin. She ended her studies in primary school and is married to a man named Marc. The couple have two children, both of whom are in their care and attend school. Florentine Ba lives together with her husband and two children, and provides for the various household needs together with her husband. In order to pay for various expenses, Florentine Ba has sold second-hand clothing door-to-door for five years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clientele and increasing her sales volume and income, Florentine Ba is seeking a third loan with ALID along with the other members of the Gbenagnon group. The two previous loans were repaid properly.

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUTIN1 est compos de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la septime fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALID, afin d'lever le niveau de son activit. La reprsentante du groupe, du nom de Elisabeth est celle qui a la main leve sur la photo. Elisabeth est ge de 58 ans et vit au Bnin. Elisabeth na pas frquent. Elisabeth est une veuve et mre de quatre enfants, dont certains scolariss et deux restent sa charge. Elisabeth vit seule avec ses deux enfants qui restent sa charge et assure seule ses divers besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Afin dassurer ses diverses charges, Elisabeth vend depuis trois ans, divers produits et des charbons de bois son domicile. Elisabeth sapprovisionne dans une ville du Bnin. Dans la qute de la satisfaction de sa clientle et pour accrotre son chiffre daffaires et son revenu, Elisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUTIN1, un septime crdit auprs de ALID. Les six premiers prts ont t bien rembourss.
texts.en:
JESUTIN1 Group is made up of three women who are friends. For the seventh time, the members of this group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALID, in order to bolster their businesses.
The group's representative, named Elisabeth, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 58 years old and lives in Benin. She never attended school. She's a widow and the mother of four children, out of whom some attend school. She still has to support two of them.
Elisabeth lives alone with the two children who are in her care, and provides for herself and them on her own. In order to ensure that her various expenses are covered, she's been selling various products and charcoal at her home for three years.
She gets her supplies in one of Benin's cities. Eager to meet customer demand, and in order to increase her revenue and income, Elisabeth, together with the other members of the group, is seeking her seventh loan from ALID. The first six loans were repaid without problems.

loan.use: to buy various food products and sacks of charcoal

The couple has four school-attending children to support. Elisabeth lives together with her husband and children, and the couple covers the various household expenses together.
In order to provide for her family, Elisabeth has been selling mobile phones through the distribution system for three years. As a secondary business, she also sells hair extensions and cosmetics.

The group's facilitator, named Akpam, is raising her hand in the photo. Akpam is 26 years old and single. She has not attended school. She lives alone and takes care of her own needs. In order to support herself, she has been selling clothes, bissap tea (made from hibiscus flowers) and popsicles for three years. This business allows her to provide for herself without any major difficulty. Akpam buys her merchandise in Togo. In order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover and income, Akpam is requesting a second loan from ALID, along with the other two members of GLORIA2. The groups's first loan was well repaid.

loan.use: To buy clothes, cartons of milk and sugar.

loan.name: Ayidote Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La reprsentante du groupe Jeannette (dont la main est leve sur la photo), est ge de 34 ans. Jeannette est marie un certain Didier. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolariss et leur charge. Jeannette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Jeannette a arrt lcole au niveau primaire et a appris la coiffure. Pour faire face ses diffrentes charges, Jeannette exerce la coiffure son domicile. De faon secondaire, Jeannette vend des mches et des produits de beaut. Jeannette sapprovisionne dans une ville du Bnin. Dans la qute de la satisfaction de sa clientle et en vue largir son activit, Jeannette sollicite un sixime crdit auprs de ALID, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE. Ce crdit leur servira mieux rpondre aux demandes de leur clientle et se faire plus de profits. Les cinq premiers prts ont t bien rembourss.
texts.en: AYIDOTE is a group composed of 3 friends. The group representative, Jeannette (the one raising her hand on the picture), is 34. She is married to a man named Didier. They care for their 3 children, who all attend school. Jeannette lives with her husband and her children. They both take care of the family financially. Jeannette quit school at the primary level and went on to learn hairdressing. To meet the financial needs of her family, Jeannette works as a hairdresser at home. In addition to that, Jeannette sells hair extensions and beauty products. She buys these items in a city in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her business, Jeannette, along with the other members of AYIDOTE, is applying for a sixth loan from ALID. Thanks to this loan, they will be able to better meet the needs of their customers and to make more profit. The first five loans have been successfully paid back.

loan.use: to buy hair extensions and beauty products.

loan.name: Philomne

texts.fr: Philomne est ge de 38 ans et vit au Bnin. Philomne na pas frquent lcole. Philomne est marie un soudeur du nom de Victor. Le couple a sept enfants tous scolariss et leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs sept enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Philomne vend depuis une quinzaine dannes, divers produits et des condiments au Bnin. Grce au revenu que lui gnre cette activit, Philomne contribue aux diffrentes dpenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientle de plus en plus grandissante, Philomne sollicite un cinquime crdit auprs de ALID. Les quatre premiers prts ont t bien rembourss.
texts.en: Philomne is 38 and lives in Benin. She never went to school. She is married to Victor, a welder. They have 7 children, who all attend school and live with them. They both take care of the family financially. To meet the financial needs of her family, Philomne has been selling various products and condiments in Benin for about 15 years. Thanks to the profits generated by this activity, Philomne is able to help support her family. In order to meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base, she is applying for a fifth loan from ALID. The first four loans have been successfully paid back.

loan.use: to buy various condiments and drinks.

loan.name: Eliane

texts.fr: Eliane est ge de 38 ans et vit au Bnin. Eliane na jamais frquent lcole. Eliane est marie a un certain Roger. Le couple a quatre enfants tous et leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Eliane vend depuis quatre ans des tissus et des produits vivriers son domicile. Paralllement cette activit, Eliane vend des chaussures, des jus de bissape et des glaces. Grce au revenu que lui gnre cette activit, Eliane contribue aux diffrentes dpenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientle de plus en plus grandissante, Eliane sollicite pour une quatrime fois un crdit auprs de ALID. Les trois crdits reus antrieurement par Eliane ont t bien rembourss.
texts.en: Eliane is 38 and lives in Benin. She never went to school. She is married to a man named Roger. Together they provide for their 4 children, who all live with them. In order to contribute to family-related expenses, Eliane has been selling fabrics and food products at home for 4 years. In addition to this activity, she sells shoes, hibiscus juice, and ice cream. Thanks to the profits generated by this activity, Eliane is able to help support her family. In order to meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base, she is applying for a fourth loan from ALID. Eliane has successfully paid back all 3 previous loans.

loan.use: to buy food products.

loan.name: Edwige

texts.fr: Edwige est ge de 36 ans et vit au Bnin. Edwige a arrt lcole au niveau primaire. Edwige est marie un certain Geames. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolariss et leur charge. Edwige vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Pour assurer les divers besoins, Edwige vend depuis cinq ans, des charbons de bois, des jus de bissape et des boissons son domicile. Edwige sapprovisionne dans un march du Bnin et Lom. Grce au revenu que lui gnre cette activit, Edwige contribue aux diffrentes charges de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientle de plus en plus grandissante, Edwige sollicite un crdit auprs de ALID.
texts.en: Edwige is 36 and lives in Benin. She quit school at the primary level. She is married to a man named Geames. They both care for their 3 children, who all attend school. Edwige lives with her husband and her children. They both take care of the family financially. In order to contribute to family-related expenses, Edwige has been selling charcoal, drinks, and hibiscus juice at home for 5 years. She buys these items at a market in Benin and in Lom. Thanks to the profits generated by this activity, Edwige is able to help support her family. In order to meet the ever-growing needs of her customers, she is applying for a loan from ALID.

loan.use: to buy drinks.

loan.name: Massavo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MASSAVO est compos de trois personnes qui habitent le mme quartier. C'est la deuxime fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALID, afin d'lever le niveau de son activit. La reprsentante du groupe, du nom de Philomne est celle qui a la main leve sur la photo. Philomne est ge de 42 ans et vit au Bnin. Philomne est une veuve et mre de deux enfants tous scolariss et sa charge. Philomne vit seule avec ses deux enfants. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges et ceux de ses deux enfants, Philomne vend depuis dix ans, des boules dakassa (pte faite base de l'amidon du mas) son domicile. Philomne s'approvisionne dans un march du Bnin. Dans la qute de la satisfaction de sa clientle et pour accrotre son chiffre daffaires et son revenu, Philomne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MASSAVO, un deuxime crdit auprs de ALID. Ce crdit leur permettra surement hausser le niveau de leur activit et se faire plus de profit. Le premier prt a t bien rembours.
texts.en: MASSAVO is a group composed of 3 people who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that this group requests a loan from ALID, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Philomne, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Philomne is 42 and lives in Benin. She is widow and a mother of 2. She takes care of her children, who both attend school. Philomne lives by herself with her two children. In order to meet the financial needs of her family, she has been selling akassa [a thick cornmeal porridge] at home for 10 years. Philomne buys the necessary ingredients in a market in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Philomne, along with the other members of MASSAVO, is applying for a second loan from ALID. This loan will help them enhance their business and make more profit. The first loan has been successfully paid back.

loan.use: to buy bags of corn to be processed.

loan.name: Losambo Plus Group

texts.en:
Losambo Plus is a group of 28 owners of small businesses chaired by Antho. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI (Micro-Finance Institution) HOPE DRC to grow their businesses.
Antho is determined to be a successful businesswoman. She operates a general store. She became a microentrepreneur in 2001. She already received two loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory. She will buy items for resale in order to reinforce her working capital and increase the profit. She will seek to make more profit by stocking more goods preferred by her customers.
Antho's business brings in a profit of US$ 480 per month. Antho is 51 years old, unmarried, and the mother of three children whose ages range between 16 and 23. One of them attends school. She is also taking care of her grandchild.

loan.use: to purchase items for resale in her store.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Exode Plus Group

texts.en:
Stephan is the leader of the Community Bank named Exode Plus, which consists of 29 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.
Stephan sells pairs of shoes, slippers, etc. for women at a market located mid-east of Kinshasa. He started his business in 2005. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. He has already received MFI HOPE DRC loans twice and fully repaid them. The loans he has received have helped him support his family.
Stephan makes US$60 profit each week. With the next loan he intends to purchase more pairs of slippers needed by his customers and generate additional profits. His ambition is to someday open a shoe shop in his area. He is 49 years old, married and the father of five children whose ages vary between 4 and 13. All of them attend school.

loan.use: to buy more pairs of slippers to sell.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo
